1. [*] The preparer of the book for Al-Shamela said: Printed with: 'Al-Dhayl ala Dhayl Al-Ibar' by Al-Iraqi. It starts from the year 764 AH, and the deaths of the year 775 AH are missing from it, as he did not create a heading for it. This supplement reaches us up to the deaths of the year 778 AH (as stated in the introduction of the printed investigation; see the full introduction in the book 'Dhayl Al-Iraqi ala Al-Ibar' by Al-Iraqi, also published in Al-Shamela).

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Tail of the Supplement
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. May Allah bless the Prophet Muhammad, his family, and his companions and grant them peace.
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Four (764 AH)
453 - / [194 Verso] In it, in Mecca, the righteous Sheikh Abu al-Abbas Ahmad (1) al-Murshidi, brother of the famous saint Sheikh Muhammad (2) al-Murshidi [died].
454 - And in Medina, the reciter Muhammad (3) bin Abdullah al-Dimashqi al-Uqaybi, resident of the Two Holy Mosques. He read the Seven [Recitations] under Ibn Baskhan (4) and Al-Raqqi (5), and people benefited from him.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 259-260; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 120; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 400; and Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 226.
2. He is: Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Ibrahim, died in 737 AH. Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Dhahabi, p. 198-199; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 3: 372-373; and A'yan al-Asr 4: 532-536.
3. His biography is in: Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 2: 63-64; Ta'rif Dhawi al-Ula, p. 151; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 400-401; and Al-Tuhfa Al-Latifa 3: 6036.
4. He is: Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Baskhan - with a Fatha on the Ba' and a Sukun on the Sad - Ibn Ayn al-Dawla, Badr al-Din the Reciter of Damascus, died in 743 AH. Tabaqat al-Qurra by Al-Dhahabi, p. 1274-1275; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 2: 159-161; and A'yan al-Asr 4: 282-287.
5. He is: Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Ali, died in 742 AH, and his biography preceded under number (18).

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
455 - And in Cairo, Al-Imad Muhammad (1) bin al-Hasan bin Ali bin Umar al-Qurashi al-Isnawi, brother of Sheikh Abd al-Rahim. He was knowledgeable in the two foundations (Usul al-Din and Usul al-Fiqh), disagreement (Khilaf), and dialectics (Jadal), to the point that his brother said: 'He has no equal in looking into them.'
456 - And the noble Salah al-Din Muhammad (2) bin Ismail bin Yahya bin Ismail bin Jahbal al-Halabi al-Qurashi, in Ramadan. He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas the 'Mu'jam Ibn Jami'', and from Ibn Daqiq al-Eid his 'Tusa'iyyat', and he narrated hadith. Al-Iraqi and Al-Haythami heard from him.
457 - And in Cairo, Al-Izz Abd al-Aziz (3) bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Aziz al-Qaysi al-Maliki, at the beginning of Rajab.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 368-369; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 1: 182-184; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 260-261; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 121-122; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 197; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 401-402; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 325; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 236-237; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 161-163; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 421-422.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 268; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 132; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 177-178, titled: Nasir al-Din; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 236; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 392.
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 118-119; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 404; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 232; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 382, where it says: Al-Fishi.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard from Ibn al-Sawwaf what he had heard of 'Sunan al-Nasa'i'. The two Hafiz (1) heard from him.
458 - And Hayyan (2), son of the Professor Abu Hayyan, in Rajab. He heard from Ibn al-Sawwaf and a group.
459 - And Abu al-Naja Muhammad (3) bin al-Husayn bin Samura al-Bahnasi the Reciter, in Rajab. He heard Ibn al-Sawwaf.
460 - And in it in Damascus, its preacher Abu al-Thana' Mahmud (4) bin [Ibrahim bin] Jumla al-Mahaji al-Shafi'i, in Ramadan, aged 57 years.
foot_note:
1. Meaning: Al-Iraqi and Al-Haythami, as mentioned by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi in his supplement to his father's tail.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 120-121; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 404; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 227; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 81.
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 123; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 405; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 427.
4. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass by Al-Dhahabi, p. 279; A'yan al-Asr 5: 405-406; Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 367-368; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 385-386; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 1: 392-393; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 265-266; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 129-130; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, 405; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 460; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 240-241; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 184-185; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 332-333.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
461 - And the skilled Usuli (Principles of Jurisprudence scholar) Harun (1) - also named Abd al-Wahhab - bin Abd al-Rahman al-Akhmimi, in Dhu al-Qi'dah.
462 - And the skilled Imam Khalil (2) bin Aybak al-Safadi, in Shawwal, aged about 68 years.
463 - And the skilled Imam Nasir al-Din Muhammad (3) bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Aziz al-Qunawi, Ibn al-Rabwa al-Dimashqi al-Hanafi. He explained 'Al-Jami' al-Kabir' (4) and 'Al-Manar'. He read 'Al-Jami' al-Kabir' under Sadr al-Din Ali al-Hanafi, from his reading of it under its author (5) Sadr al-Din Sulayman.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 365-366; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 123-124; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 276-277; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 140-141; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 406; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 232; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 138-139; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 425.
2. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass by Al-Dhahabi, p. 91-92; Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 364; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 269-270; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 5-32; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 134-138; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 408-410; Al-Muqaffa Al-Kabir 3: 767-768; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 77-78; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 227-229; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 119-121; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 87-88.
3. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 369-370; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 256-258; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah in Tabaqat Al-Hanafiyyah 3: 42-43; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 115-117; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 410-411; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 365; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 235; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 327.
4. He titled it: 'Al-Durr Al-Munir fi Hall Ishkal Al-Jami' Al-Kabir'.
5. Above it in the author's handwriting: 'Thus.' I think he is quoting from the author of Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah, for it is his phrasing.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
464 - And the historian Salah al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Shakir.
465 - And the chief Musnid (narrator) Badr al-Din Ahmad (2) bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Mahmud bin Abi al-Qasim bin al-Jukhi, also known as Ibn al-Zaqqaq, of Maghrebi origin, Damascene, in Ramadan aged eighty-odd years. He heard from Al-Fakhr the 'Sunan of Abu Dawud' and others, and from Zaynab bint Makki the 'Musnad of Ahmad', and from Abd al-Rahman bin al-Zain, and others.
466 - And Muhammad (3) bin Ibrahim bin Yusuf bin Abdullah bin Ata, in Shawwal. He heard from Al-Fakhr some of his 'Mashyakha'.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 369; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 263-264; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar, p. 128; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 412-413; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 238; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 451-452. The author was unjust in his biography.
2. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 123-124; Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 361; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 264; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 127-128; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 413-414; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 270-271; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 225; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 250.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' (twice) first 2: 274 as Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Yusuf, and second 2: 276 as Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Ata; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 1: 137, combining the two forms as: Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Yusuf bin Abdullah bin Ata; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 414; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 412-413 as Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Yusuf bin .... bin Muhammad bin Ata al-Hanafi; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 301.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
467 - [And the Sheikhah] Khadija (1) bint Muhammad bin Abd al-Qawi bin Badran al-Mardawi, on the ninth of Jumada al-Ula. She attended in the year 87 [687 AH] under Al-Fakhr his 'Mashyakha', 'Juz Ibn Zabban', and 'Akhbar Bishr al-Hafi'.
468 - And Abu al-Hasan Ali (2) bin al-Shuja' Abd al-Rahman [bin] Abi al-Fath al-Qatta' al-Salihi. He heard from Al-Fakhr his 'Mashyakha' (3), and narrated.
469 - And Abu al-Hasan Ali (4) bin Ibrahim al-Sahyuni. He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas.
foot_note:
1. Her biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 256; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 115; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 414. What is between the brackets is blurred in the copy, and what is established is from the last source, and there is a complete correspondence in the wording between them.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 259; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 119-120; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 415; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 234, where he appears as: Al-Natta', except for Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara which listed him as here; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 60, where he is: Al-Batta'.
3. In the previous sources: He heard from him 'Mashyakha al-Ushari', by Abu Talib Muhammad bin Ali bin al-Fath, not 'Mashyakha al-Fakhr'.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 297; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 145; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 416; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 472; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 8.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
470 - And Muhammad (1) bin Ishaq al-Amidi. He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas.
471 - And Ala' al-Din Ali (2) bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Umar bin Uthman, Ibn al-Afif al-Dimashqi, in Shawwal. Ahmad bin Asakir gave him license (Ijazah).
472 - And in the city of Hebron, its judge, Abu al-Rabi' Sulayman (3) bin Salim bin Abd al-Nasir al-Ghazzi al-Shafi'i, in Shawwal. He heard from Ali bin Harun al-Tha'labi, Al-Mut'im, Al-Hajjar, and Wazira.
473 - And in Aleppo, the Judge Al-Kamal Ahmad (4) bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Qahir al-Nasibi al-Halabi, aged 69 years.
foot_note:
1. He is also called: Ahmad. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 278; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 142; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 416; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 268; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 236; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 103, 3: 382, saying: It preceded under Ahmad bin Ishaq.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 271-272; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 133-134; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 417; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 21.
3. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 105; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 270-271; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 139; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 417-418; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 110-111; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 229-230; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 152.
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 145-146; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 419; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 353-354; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 224-225; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 247-248.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard a lot from Sunqur (1) al-Zayni.
474 - And Abu Ishaq Ibrahim (2) bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd Allah bin Jama'ah, in Dhu al-Hijjah, after his hearing became heavy. He heard from Ibn Asakir, and resided for a period in the Three Mosques.
475 - And in Alexandria, the Musnid Abu al-Hasan Ali (3) bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Salih al-Ardi, in Ramadan, 87 years old. He was the sole narrator from Zaynab bint Makki for hearing the 'Musnad Ahmad', and he heard from Al-Fakhr the 'Jami' al-Tirmidhi', and from Ibn al-Zain 'Juz al-Ansari'.
476 - And also in it, the Musnid Imad al-Din Abu Abdullah Muhammad (4) bin Abi al-Hasan bin Abi al-Layth al-Lakhmi al-Iskandari, aged 91 years.
foot_note:
1. He is: Sunqur bin Abdullah al-Qada'i al-Zayni al-Asadi, Abu Sa'id, died in 706 AH. Al-Muqtafi 3: 340-341; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 276-277; and Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 15: 496.
2. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 362-363; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 280, dating his death in Muharram 765 AH; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 143-144; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 3: 230; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 419-420; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 222-223; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 35-36.
3. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 366; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 265; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 125-126; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 420; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 537-538; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 233; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 20.
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 144-145, under: Muhammad bin Muhammad; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 421-422; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 247, as: Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Muhammad.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard from Muhammad bin Abd al-Khaliq bin Tarkhan the 'Jami' al-Tirmidhi'. The two Hafiz (1) heard from him.
477 - And Muhammad (2) bin Ali bin Abd al-Karim bin Abi Abdullah al-Makhili, aged 97 (3) years. He heard from Abd al-Nasir (4) al-Maryuti, the companion of Ibn Imad.
foot_note:
1. i.e., Al-Iraqi and Al-Haythami, as in Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara.
2. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 111-112; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 422; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 22-23.
3. Al-Wali Al-Iraqi mentioned in Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar that he was born in 677 AH, so his age on the day of his death would be 87 years, which agrees with what Ibn Hajar mentioned in Al-Durar Al-Kamina, saying: If his hearing was according to his age, his chain of transmission would be high.
4. He is: Abd al-Nasir bin Ali bin Yahya, one of the great reciters in the Frontier (Alexandria), died after 680 AH. Tabaqat al-Qurra by Al-Dhahabi, p. 1175-1176.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Five (765 AH)
478 - In it, in Mecca, its judge Abu al-Yumn Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Qasim al-Hazzazi [died], while removed from office in Jumada al-Ula, aged about sixty years.
479 - And in the Prophetic Medina, its hadith scholar and historian, Al-Afif Abu al-Siyadah Abdullah (2) son of Al-Jamal Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Khalaf al-Matari al-Madani, in Rabi' al-Awwal, aged 67 years.
480 - And in Cairo, its Musnid Fath al-Din Abu al-Haram Muhammad (3) bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Haram al-Qalanisi, in Jumada, aged 81 years and some.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 176; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 1: 367-368; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 125-126; Idah Bughyat Ahl Al-Basara, p. 434-435; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 389-390; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 254; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 156-157; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 348.
2. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass by Al-Dhahabi, p. 125; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 206-208; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 34-35; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 282; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 155-156; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 441-444; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 332-333; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 250; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 284-285.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 284; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 160-162; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 437-438; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 220; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 258; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 235.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He attended under Abd al-Rahim bin Khatib al-Mazza the 'Musnad of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri from Musnad Ahmad' and 'Juz al-Ghatrif', and under Ghazi 'Al-Ghaylaniyyat'.
481 - And Judge Izz al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Abd al-Mu'ti bin Salim al-Ghafiqi, Ibn al-Sab', Judge of Taybah (Medina), while removed from office. He heard Ghazi al-Halawi, Ishaq (2) bin Darbas, Ibn al-Sham'ah, Muhammad bin Azzun, and a group.
482 - And the Sharif Abu Bakr Abd al-Mun'im (3) bin Muhammad al-Husayni al-Misri, in Jumada al-Akhirah. He heard from Ibn Abi al-Dhikr, Ibn al-Ward, and Al-Sarfandi. He lived eighty years.
483 - And in Damanhur, the Muhaddith Alam al-Din Abu al-Qasim Abd al-Rahman (4) bin Nasr Allah bin Tala'i'.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 284-285; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 3: 237-238; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 154; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 281-282; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 30-31; and left the date of his death blank.
2. He is: Ishaq bin Abd al-Rahim bin Muhammad bin Darbas al-Marani, Al-Dhahabi heard from him in 695 AH, then news of him was cut off. Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 166-167.
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 163-164; and Lahz Al-Alhaz, p. 145.
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 152; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 251; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 349; and Lahz Al-Alhaz, p. 145.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard 'Mashiakhat al-Sibt' under Al-Utbi (1), and some of 'Al-Muwatta' under Al-Jalal bin Abd al-Salam, and he had a concern for hadith. The two Hafiz (2) heard from him.
484 - And in Damascus, the Musnid and Hafiz Abu al-Mahasin Muhammad (3) bin Ali bin al-Hasan bin Hamza al-Husayni, in Sha'ban, aged sixty years. He heard from Muhammad bin Abi Bakr bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Da'im and Ahmad bin Ali al-Jazari, and in Egypt from Al-Maydumi, and he cared for this affair. He summarized Al-Mizzi's 'Atraf' and 'Tahdhib'. Al-Dhahabi took from him and mentioned him in his 'Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass' (4).
485 - And Imam Abu al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman (5) bin Ali bin Abi al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi, in Jumada.
foot_note:
1. He is: Umar bin Muhammad bin Yahya al-Utbi, Abu Hafs, known as Ibn Jabi al-Ahbas, died in 724 AH. Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 80-81; A'yan al-Asr 3: 650; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 191.
2. i.e., Al-Iraqi and Al-Haythami, as in Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 290-291; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 166-168; Al-Radd Al-Wafir ala man za'ama anna Ibn Taymiyyah Kafir, p. 105-106; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 344-345; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 256-257; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 174-176; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 61-62.
4. He was not mentioned in the printed version of the Mu'jam.
5. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 286-287; Al-Muntaqa min Mu'jam Shuyukh Ibn Rajab Al-Hanbali, p. 147-148; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 162; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 264; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 251; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 336; and Al-Maqsad Al-Arshad 2: 99-100.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard from Ismail bin al-Farra and others, and narrated. He was a man of virtue and worship.
486 - And the centenarian Ismail (1) bin Abi Bakr bin Ahmad, known as Ibn al-Sayf al-Harrani, in Jumada al-Akhirah. He heard from Ahmad bin Shayban a portion of 'Amali al-Samarqandi' and 'Al-Arba'in al-Suba'iyyah' by Abu al-As'ad al-Qushayri, and narrated, and people benefited from him.
487 - And Nasir al-Din Muhammad (2) bin al-Sarim Uzbek al-Khazandari al-Badri al-Dimashqi al-Hanafi. He heard a lot from Muhammad (3) bin Abd al-Mu'min al-Suri, narrated, and performed Hajj more than once.
488 - And Umar (4) al-Shahtabi, in Al-Nayrab in the Ghouta of Damascus. He heard from Al-Fakhr his 'Mashyakha' and 'Shama'il al-Tirmidhi'.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 287; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Wali al-Din al-Iraqi, p. 163-164; and Lahz Al-Alhaz by Ibn Fahd, p. 144.
2. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 367-369; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 288; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, 164; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 186; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 255; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 379-380, dating his death in this year or the following one.
3. He died in 690 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 261; and Tarikh Al-Islam 15: 673.
4. He is: Umar bin Muhammad bin Abi Bakr bin Abi al-Nur. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 313; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 294; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 170-171; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 238; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 442; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 253; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 185.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
489 - And the Sharifah Sitt al-Fuqaha (1) bint al-Sharaf Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Ali al-Abbasi al-Isfahani, in Sha'ban. She attended under Shamiyah bint al-Bakri in the third year of her age at the Citadel of Shaizar the third, fourth, sixth, seventh, and eleventh [parts] of 'Amali al-Jawhari'.
490 - And Al-Izz, Abu al-Mafakhir Muhammad (2) bin al-Amin Salim bin Abi al-Durr Abd al-Rahman al-Salihi, in it [Salihia] in Safar. He heard 'Sahih Muslim' under Ahmad bin Asakir, and narrated.
491 - And Amin al-Din Muhammad (3) bin Abd al-Qadir bin Barakat bin Abi al-Fada'il al-Ba'li al-Salihi, in it, in Rajab. He heard under Yusuf al-Ghasuli 'Al-Muntaqa min Sab'at Ajza' min Hadith al-Mukhallis', and under Isa (4) al-Mughari and Fatima (5) bint al-Bata'ihi 'Musnad al-Shafi'i', and narrated.
foot_note:
1. Her biography is in: Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Husayni, p. 287, dating her death in 752 AH; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 290; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 166; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 127-128.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 282; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 154; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 218; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 442.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 289; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 164-165; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 275; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 20, where he appears occasionally as: Muhammad bin Abd al-Qadir bin Abi al-Barakat.
4. He is: Isa bin Abi Muhammad bin Abd al-Razzaq al-Attar, died in 704 AH. Al-Muqtafi 3: 268-269; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 88-89; and A'yan al-Asr 3: 726-727.
5. She is: Fatima bint Ibrahim bin Mahmud bin Jawhar al-Bata'ihi, died in 711 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 12-13; and Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 103.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
492 - And in it, it was said in Jerusalem, its hadith scholar, Al-Shihab Abu Mahmud Ahmad (1) bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Hilal al-Maqdisi, aged 51 years. He heard in Damascus from the companions of Ibn Abd al-Da'im, and in Egypt from the companions of Al-Najib, and he had a concern for hadith. Al-Dhahabi mentioned him in 'Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass' and said: A beneficial student, quick in reading.
493 - And in Aleppo, the literary scholar Al-Izz Abu Muhammad al-Hasan (2) bin Ali bin al-Hasan al-Abbasi, Ibn al-Banna al-Halabi.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 33; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 172-173; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 247-248; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 242.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 175; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 249; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 21-22.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Six (766 AH)
494 - In it, in Damascus, in Dhu al-Qi'dah, the Scholar Al-Qutb Muhammad (1) bin al-Nizam Muhammad al-Razi, known as Al-Tahtani al-Shafi'i. He explained 'Al-Hawi', and had 'Hawashin' (footnotes) on 'Al-Kashshaf' up to Surah Taha, and explained 'Al-Matali'' and 'Al-Isharat' by Ibn Sina. He was called Al-Tahtani to distinguish him from another Qutb who was living with him in the upper part of the Madrasa.
495 - And Al-Sharaf Ya'qub (2) bin Ya'qub bin Ibrahim al-Hariri al-Ba'li, in the early parts of the year. He heard from Al-Fakhr his 'Mashyakha'.
496 - And in Cairo, Al-Shams Muhammad (3) bin Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Abi Bakr bin Ibrahim bin Ya'qub bin Ilyas al-Ansari al-Khazraji al-Bayani, in Dhu al-Qi'dah aged eighty years.
foot_note:
1. He is also called: Mahmud. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 9: 274-275; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 1: 322-323; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 299-300; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 184-185; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 366-367; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 267-268; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 183-184; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 339.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 180; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 326; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 538; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 268; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 436.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 301; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 186-188; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 162-163; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida (twice) 3: 285-286, 318-319; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 266; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 295.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He attended under Zaynab bint Makki, and heard from Al-Fakhr and Ibn al-Mujawir. He was a lover of narration.
497 - And the Muhaddith Abu al-Ma'ali Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Abi Bakr bin Yusuf al-Mizzi al-Hariri. He heard from Judge Sulayman, Yahya bin Sa'd, and Al-Mut'im.
498 - And Imam Zayn al-Din Muhammad (2) bin Umar bin Mahmud, known as Ibn al-Sarraj al-Hanafi al-Misri, in Dhu al-Qi'dah. He heard from Musa al-Musawi 'Sahih Muslim', and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 214; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 2: 169; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 298; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 182-183; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 318-319; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 266-267; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 274.
2. His biography is in: Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 3: 292-293; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 186; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 344; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 267; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 115.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Seven (767 AH)
499 - In it, in Mecca, the Judge of Muslims, Al-Izz Abu Umar Abd al-Aziz (1) bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd al-Din bin Jama'ah al-Kinani al-Shafi'i al-Misri, on 13 Jumada al-Akhirah, aged seventy-three and a half years. He attended under Ahmad bin Asakir 'Juz al-Baytuta', and under Umar bin al-Qawwas 'Mu'jam Ibn Jami''. He attained in his judgeship an elevation that did not happen to others.
500 - And in Egypt, [Imam Abu al-Safa Khalil (2) bin] Ishaq bin Musa al-Jundi al-Maliki. Author of 'Al-Mukhtasar' and explainer of 'Mukhtasar Ibn al-Hajib'. He was an expert in Fiqh, Usul, and Arabic.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 401-402; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 18: 556-557; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 79-81; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 1: 388-390; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 305-308; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 200-207; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 50-53; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 5: 457-460; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 298-303; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 284-286; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 378-382; and Raf' al-Isr 'an Qudat Misr, p. 243-246.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dibaj Al-Mudhahhab 1: 357-358; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 196-198; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 281; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 86. What is between the brackets is obscured in the copy due to a restoration error, and what is established is from the mentioned sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
501 - And in Cairo, Sheikh Ali (1) al-Aqsara'i, and he was advanced in age. He mentioned that he heard 'Awarif al-Ma'arif' [by Al-Suhrawardi from someone who narrates it from him] (2).
502 - And Shams al-A'immah Mahmud (3) al-Kurdi, teacher at the Nasiriyyah Madrasa (4).
503 - And the Musnid Ahmad (5) bin Abd al-Ahad bin Abi al-Fath al-Harrani. He heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf and Al-Dimyati, and narrated.
504 - And in Alexandria, its Musnid Al-Jamal Muhammad (6) bin Ahmad [bin Hibat Allah], known as Ibn al-Buri, aged 88 years. He heard from Muhammad bin Abd al-Khaliq bin Tarkhan 'Jami' al-Tirmidhi', part of 'Al-Shifa', and three sessions [of 'Amali'] (7) Ali bin al-Mufaddal.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 208-209; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 286; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 144-145.
2. Blurred in the copy, and what is established is from Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, quoting his father.
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 211; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 287-288; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 343, dating his death in Ramadan.
4. Ibn Qadi Shuhba said: Teacher at the Madrasa of Sultan Hasan. I say: It is also known as the Al-Jami' Al-Nasiri Hasan, located facing the Citadel of the Mountain in what is between the Citadel and Birkat al-Fil, the site of Amir Yalbugha al-Yahyawi's house, started in 757 AH. Al-Mawa'iz wa Al-I'tibar 4: 269-281.
5. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 214-215; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 144.
6. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 214, titled: Kamal al-Din; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 144-145; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 371. What is between brackets is obscured in the copy, established from the sources.
7. Missing from the copy, established from Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Iraqi.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
505 - And the Musnid Abdullah (1) bin Abi Bakr bin Umar al-Iskandari, [known as Ibn al-Nabulusi]. He heard from Al-Taj al-Gharrafi all of 'Al-Khil'iyyat'.
506 - And in Damascus, Judge Abu al-Abbas Ahmad (2) bin Ibrahim al-Ayntabi al-Hanafi, explainer of 'Al-Majma'' and 'Al-Mughni', on 7 Muharram, aged over sixty. He took from Al-Radi al-Mantiqi ... (3).
507 - And the great female Musnid, Umm Muhammad Sitt al-Arab (4) bint Muhammad bin al-Fakhr al-Salihiyyah, in it. She attended a lot under her grandfather. The travelers [and Imams] (5) heard from her.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 194-195; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 283; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 251.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 302-303; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 193-194; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 211; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 279-280; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 82; and Taj Al-Tarajim, p. 106.
3. Blurred in the copy. In Wafayat Ibn Rafi' and Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi: He studied under Radi al-Din al-Mantiqi and taught in several schools in Damascus. Radi al-Mantiqi is: Ibrahim bin Sulayman al-Hamawi, died in 732 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 546-547.
4. Her biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 304-305; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 199; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 419-420; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 93; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 288-289; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 127, dating her death in Jumada al-Ula.
5. Unreadable word in the copy, established from Dhayl Al-Ibar and quoted by those who came after him.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
508 - And Al-Shams Muhammad (1) bin Abd al-Qadir al-Khalili, in Shawwal. He heard Judge Sulayman and [Al-Mut'im] (2).
509 - And the beneficial Muhaddith Abu al-Thana' Mahmud (3) bin Khalifa al-Manbiji, in Dhu al-Hijjah. He heard in Baghdad from Al-Rashid bin Abi al-Qasim and Ismail al-Tabbal, and Al-Fakhr gave him license, and he narrated. Al-Dhahabi heard from him.
510 - And the long-lived Musnid Al-Shams Muhammad (4) bin Muhammad bin Salim / [195 Recto] al-Dimashqi, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 85 years. He heard from Al-Fakhr, and narrated a lot.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 308; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 212; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 286-287; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 297-298; and Al-Maqsad Al-Arshad 2: 542, in the last three as: Muhammad bin Yusuf bin Abd al-Qadir.
2. Blurred in the copy, only the letters Mim and Ta remain, so we inferred the rest of the word from his biography sources.
3. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 327-328; Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by him, p. 276-277; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 309-310; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 213; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 267-268; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 287; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 297.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 309; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 213; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 180 as: Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Salama bin Salim.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text: 511 - And in Cairo, the Musnid Muhibb al-Din Ahmad (1) bin Yusuf bin Ahmad bin Umar al-Khalati al-Misri, in Ramadan. He was the sole narrator from Al-Dimyati for hearing 'Sunan al-Daraqutni' from him, and he narrated it.
foot_note: 1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 308-309; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 210; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 204-205; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 274; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 338.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Eight (768 AH)
512 - In it, in Mecca, our Sheikh the Scholar Al-Afif Abdullah (1) bin As'ad bin Ali bin Sulayman bin Falah al-Yafi'i al-Yamani al-Shafi'i, in Jumada al-Akhirah, having reached seventy or exceeded it. He has many works in various sciences. (2) Al-Radi the Five Books.
513 - And Sheikh Ala' al-Din Ali (3) bin Muhammad bin al-Munazir bin Sa'd al-Din al-Alawi, known as Ibn al-Khwarizmi, resident of Mecca, in Rabi' al-Akhir. He has many virtues.
514 - And possessor of the Kunyas: Abu Bakr, [and] Abu Abdullah, [and] Abu al-Fath, [and] Abu al-Fada'il al-Hudhaqi (4) Muhammad (5) son of the Muhaddith [Muhammad bin Muhammad bin] al-Hasan bin Nubata al-Dimashqi,
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 10: 33; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 2: 579-583; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 313-315; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 225-227; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 5: 104-115; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 412-413; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 362-364; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 299-300; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 247-249.
2. Blurred in the copy, and Al-Taqi Al-Fasi's phrase in Dhayl Al-Taqyid is: He read under Radi al-Din Ibrahim bin Muhammad al-Tabari the Six Books except Sunan Ibn Majah.
3. His biography is in: Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 6: 252.
4. Attributed to Hudhaqah, a sub-tribe of Quda'ah. Al-Ansab by Al-Sam'ani 4: 89.
5. His biography is in: Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 278; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 459-462; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 1: 311-331; Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 9: 273; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 311-312; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 219-223; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 423; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 221-223; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 303-305; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 216-223.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
In Safar, at the Mansuri Hospital. Al-Fakhr and Zaynab bint Makki and Yusuf bin al-Mujawir and Abd al-Rahman bin al-Zain gave him license. He heard in his third year from Ghazi four parts of 'Al-Ghaylaniyyat', and he was the sole narrator of them from him, and of hearing 'Al-Sirah' [from Abu] (1) al-Ma'ali al-Abraquhi. He was the sole narrator from Al-Taqi Ubayd (2) al-Is'irdi, and Al-Baha' bin al-Nahhas the Grammarian, and Abu al-Ma'ali bin al-Sabuni, and Abd al-Rahim al-Damiri, and his grandfather Al-Sharaf bin Nubata. The Imams heard from him, and his poetry is at the peak.
515 - And Sheikh Yusuf (3) bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Ali bin Khadr al-Kurdi, famous as Al-Ajami. Owner of the Zawiya (4) in Al-Qarafa, and he died there in the middle of Jumada al-Ula.
516 - And in Damascus, the Muhaddith Ali (5) bin al-Husayn al-Banna al-Misri.
foot_note:
1. Blurred in the copy, established by context.
2. He is: Ubayd bin Muhammad bin Abbas, Hafiz Taqi al-Din Abu al-Abbas al-Is'irdi, died in 692 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 333-334; Tarikh Al-Islam 15: 752; and Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 19: 429.
3. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Awliya by Ibn al-Mulaqqin, p. 492-493; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 224-225; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 559-560; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 306; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 463.
4. Ibn al-Mulaqqin mentioned in Tabaqat Al-Awliya that the aforementioned had several Zawiyas, including this one where he died. Al-Maqrizi mentioned in Al-Mawa'iz wa Al-I'tibar 3: 377, 385, that he had a Zawiya at the site of an old church within the Hukr of Aqbugha.
5. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 315-316; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 228-229; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 301; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 42.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He narrated a lot from the companions of Al-Fakhr and Al-Najib.
517 - ... (1) Imam Mu'in al-Din Sulayman (2) bin Ali bin Amin al-Qunawi al-Hanafi, teacher of the Iqbaliyyah (3) Hanafiyyah. He heard from Sheikh al-Shuyukh Ali (4) bin Ismail al-Qunawi.
518 - And in Baalbek, Judge Abu al-Fadl Muhammad (5) son of [the Chief Judge] Muhammad bin Isa al-Ba'li al-Shafi'i, Ibn al-Majd [in] Dhu al-Hijjah. He heard Muhammad bin Musharraf and a group. A 'Mashyakha' was compiled for him.
foot_note:
1. Blurred in the copy, perhaps meaning: And in it also. For the subject of the biography died in Damascus.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 317-318; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 229-230; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 299; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 159.
3. Established by Jamal al-Din Iqbal, freedman of Sitt al-Sham, and servant of Nur al-Din the Martyr, and after him King Al-Nasir Salah al-Din al-Ayyubi, in 603 AH, between Bab al-Faraj and Bab al-Faradis in Damascus. Al-Daris 1: 474-476.
4. He is: Ali bin Ismail bin Yusuf al-Tabrizi, then al-Qunawi, Sheikh Ala' al-Din, Chief Judge, died in 729 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 367-370; Dhayl Tarikh Al-Islam by Al-Dhahabi, p. 332-334; and A'yan al-Asr 3: 285-295.
5. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 259; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 319-320; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 230; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 409; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 367; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 302-303; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 206-207. What is between brackets is mostly obscured except for a few letters, used to establish the text from previous sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
519 - And in Hama, its judge Al-Amin Abd al-Wahhab (1) bin Ahmad bin Wahban al-Dimashqi al-Hanafi, aged about forty years. He was a jurist skilled in Recitations and Arabic, of praiseworthy conduct.
520 - And in it in Egypt, ... (2) the State in it, Yalbugha (3) al-Khassaki. He was eager for knowledge, loving of its people, and of doing good ... (3), possessed of shrewdness and opinion - may Allah Almighty have mercy on him and forgive him.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 232; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 300-301; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 423-424; and Taj Al-Tarajim, p. 198-199.
2. Blurred in the copy.
3. He is: Yalbugha bin Abdullah al-Nasiri al-Atabeki. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 216-217; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 305-306; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 438-440; and Al-Manhal Al-Safi 12: 157-162.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Sixty-Nine (769 AH)
521 - In it, in the Prophetic Medina, its judge Al-Badr Abdullah (1) bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Qasim bin Farhun al-Ya'muri al-Madani al-Maliki, aged seventy-six years. He heard from Al-Tawzari 'Muwatta' Yahya bin Yahya', and Muhammad bin al-Husayn al-Fawwi, narrator of 'Al-Khil'iyyat', gave him license, and he narrated it from him.
522 - And in Mecca, Al-Izz Ibrahim (2) son of Al-Taqi Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abi Bakr al-Samarba'i al-Misri, Ibn al-Wajih, aged 77 years. He heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf and Al-Jamal (3) bin al-Saqati 'Sunan al-Nasa'i'.
523 - And in Cairo, the skilled Imam Al-Shihab Ahmad (4) bin Lu'lu' bin Abdullah al-Misri,
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 328-329; Al-Dibaj Al-Mudhahhab 1: 454-459; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 248-249; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 456-457, dating his death in 767 AH which I think is a misspelling of 'nine' (Tis'); Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 333-334; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 334-335; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 300.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 272-273; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 3: 257; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 252; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 72 as: Al-Sahraba'i; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 61.
3. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Azim bin Ali bin Salim, Jamal al-Din, Abu Bakr, known as Ibn al-Saqati, died in 707 AH. Dhayl Mir'at al-Zaman (Abu Dhabi Ed.), p. 1189; Al-Muqtafi 3: 372-373; and A'yan al-Asr 4: 513-514.
4. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 2: 514-515; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 260-262; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 291-292; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 323-325; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 106-108; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 239-240.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Ibn al-Naqib al-Shafi'i, author of 'Mukhtasar al-Kifaya' and many works, in Ramadan. He graduated in knowledge under Sheikh Taj al-Din (1) al-Tabrizi, issued fatwas, taught, and benefited others.
524 - And in it, the skilled Judge Baha' al-Din Abdullah (2) bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Muhammad al-Qurashi, Ibn Aqil al-Misri al-Shafi'i, in Rabi' al-Awwal, aged about 73 years. He held the judgeship of the Egyptian lands in the last ten days of Jumada al-Akhirah year 759 for about eighty days, then Al-Izz bin Jama'ah was reinstated. In this short period, the measure of the two men appeared; because Ibn Aqil's actions were not praised. He took from Sheikh Ala' al-Din al-Qunawi Usul and Fiqh, and from Abu Hayyan 'Kitab Sibawayh' and 'Al-Tashil', staying with him for twelve years. Abu Hayyan said of him: 'There is no one under the sky more grammatical than Ibn Aqil.' He wrote a commentary on 'Al-Tashil' and another on 'Al-Alfiyyah', and authored a 'Tafsir'. He was intelligent, eloquent but had a lisp, and generous leaving nothing behind.
foot_note:
1. His biography preceded under number (67).
2. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 2: 239-240; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 326-328; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 245-248; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 421; Ghayat Al-Nihaya fi Tabaqat Al-Qurra 1: 428; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 348-350; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 331-332; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 129-132; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 266-269.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
525 - And the Hanafi Judge, Jamal al-Din Abdullah (1) son of Judge Ala' al-Din Ali bin Uthman bin Mustafa al-Mardini, Ibn al-Turkumani al-Hanafi, in Sha'ban. He cared for knowledge and authored a commentary on 'Al-Hidaya'. He heard from Al-Wani and Al-Khutani (2).
526 - And the Chief Judge Muwaffaq al-Din Abdullah (3) bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Malik bin Abd al-Mun'im al-Maqdisi, then al-Misri, its judge, in Muharram or Safar, having neared eighty. He heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf and others. He was knowledgeable in his school, religious, benevolent, humble, and a jurist.
527 - And Judge Badr al-Din Muhammad (4) bin Hibat Allah bin Ahmad bin Ya'la al-Turkistani al-Hanafi, in Ramadan.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 331; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 2: 316-318; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 331; Al-Muqaffa Al-Kabir 4: 615-616; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 326-329; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 333; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 276; and Raf' al-Isr, p. 191.
2. He is: Yusuf bin Umar bin Husayn al-Khutani, Badr al-Din al-Hanafi al-Sufi, died in 731 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 478-479; Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Dhahabi, p. 167; and Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 29: 271-272.
3. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 127-128; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 17: 596-597; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 239-241; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 454; Al-Muqaffa Al-Kabir 4: 118-120; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 340; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 334; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 297-298; Raf' al-Isr, p. 200-202; and Al-Maqsad Al-Arshad 2: 58-60.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 334; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 3: 385; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 256-257; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 341-342; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 278.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He cared for knowledge, taught, and Judge Siraj al-Din (1) al-Hindi al-Hanafi appointed him as deputy in judgment. Then he fell ill after two days and continued so until he died. He heard from Hafiz Abu al-Fath Ibn Sayyid al-Nas and Al-Qutb (2) al-Halabi.
528 - And Judge Baha' al-Din Khalil (3) bin Muhammad bin Ahmad, of Damascene origin, Egyptian Hanafi, in Sha'ban. He cared for knowledge, taught, and deputized in judgment for Judge Al-Jamal al-Turkmani al-Hanafi. He heard through the benefit of his maternal uncle Abd al-Qadir (4) al-Hanafi from Al-Hajjar, Muhammad (5) bin Abd al-Hamid al-Hamadani, and others.
foot_note:
1. He is: Umar bin Ishaq bin Ahmad al-Hindi al-Ghaznawi al-Hanafi, died in 773 AH. Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 389-390; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 336-338; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 436-439; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 154-155.
2. He is: Abd al-Karim bin Abd al-Nur bin Munir al-Halabi, then al-Misri, Qutb al-Din, died in 735 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman by Ibn al-Jazari 3: 809-810; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 412; and Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 19: 80-81.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 331-332; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 2: 181-182; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 252; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 329; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 92-93.
4. He is: Abd al-Qadir bin Muhammad bin Muhammad Ibn Abi al-Wafa al-Qurashi al-Hanafi, died in 775 AH, and his biography will follow under number (610).
5. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Hamid bin Muhammad bin al-Hamid al-Hamadhani, al-Misri, Taqi al-Din, died in 721 AH. Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Dhahabi, p. 120-121; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 254-255; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 493.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
529 - And Al-Kamal Abu al-Fadl Muhammad (1) son of Judge Al-Jamal son of Al-Shihab Mahmud, one of the signatories of the Dast (Royal Bench), in Ramadan, aged 43 years.
530 - And Ibn Ma'in (2), one of the notaries of the registers in Cairo, in Ramadan. He heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf some of 'Sunan al-Nasa'i'.
531 - And Judge Ala' al-Din Ali (3) bin al-Muhyi Yahya bin Fadl Allah al-Umari al-Misri, Secretary of the Secret (Katib al-Sirr) in Egypt, in Ramadan, 57 years old. He heard from his father and Asma' (4) bint Ibn Sasra. Ibn Aybak compiled forty hadiths for him. He held the position of Sultanate Secretary for 31 years, and wrote for eleven kings of the Banu Qalawun, namely: Al-Nasir Muhammad bin Qalawun, his eight sons, and his two grandsons Al-Mansur Muhammad bin al-Muzaffar Hajji and Al-Ashraf bin Husayn.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 258; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 367-368; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 338; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 297.
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 264.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 22: 322-328; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 334-335; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 257-258; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 501-505; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 336-337; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 138-138.
4. She is: Asma' bint Muhammad bin Salim bin Sasra, Umm Muhammad, died in 733 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 3: 654-655; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 187-188; and Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, extraction of Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 543-548.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
532 - And Al-Qutb Muhammad (1) bin Abi al-Thana' Mahmud son of the Judge of Jerusalem, known as Al-Hirmas. He heard from Al-Hajjar and Wazira 'Al-Sahih', and had knowledge of science. He had with Al-Nasir Hasan much acceptance; the reason being that he showed Al-Nasir Hasan something of Alchemy and ... (2), and Al-Nasir thought it was from his piety, then realized its lack, so he exiled him to Masyaf. Then he returned after that to Cairo, and remained obscure until he died.
533 - [And Imam Fakhr al-Din Muhammad (3) bin Siraj al-Din] Abd al-Latif bin Ahmad bin al-Kuwayk al-Iskandari, in it. He heard from Al-Utbi and Al-Sadid (4) bin al-Sawwaf among others.
534 - And in Asyut of Upper Egypt, the Traveler Abu Hafs Umar (5) bin Abi Bakr bin Ali bin Abi Bakr bin al-Hasan [al-Suyuti, known as Ibn Sheikh] al-Dawla, in one of the two Jumadas.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 272; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 372-373; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 342; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 253-254.
2. Unclear word in the copy.
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 259; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 340; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 24-25. What is between brackets is blurred in the copy, established from his biography sources.
4. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Majid bin Khalaf bin al-Sawwaf, Sadid al-Din, died in 723 AH. Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 26.
5. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 249; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 337; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 180-181, in all three as: Umar bin Ali bin Abi Bakr bin al-Hasan. What is between brackets is blurred in the copy, established from his biography sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He was the sole narrator from Al-Izz for hearing his 'Mashyakha' and 'Sahih Al-Bukhari', and from Ibn Khatib al-Mazza for hearing part of 'Hadith Umar al-Zayyat', and he was the last to hear from them.
535 - And Sheikh Imam Al-Jamal Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin al-Sharishi al-Dimashqi, in Shawwal, aged 74 years. He attended under Umar bin al-Qawwas 'Mu'jam Ibn Jami'' and under Ahmad bin Asakir 'Juz al-Baytuta'. He deputized in Damascus for Sheikh al-Islam Al-Bulqini, judging for one day.
536 - And in Salihiyah of Damascus, the long-lived Abu Abdullah Muhammad (2) bin al-Muhibb Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Hamid bin Abd al-Hadi, in Dhu al-Hijjah. He attended under Al-Fakhr 'Juz Ibn [Najid] (3)' and hadith of 'Baqarat Bani Isra'il', and under Al-Sayf Ali bin al-Radi al-Maqdisi forty hadiths from 'Muwatta' Yahya bin Yahya'.
537 - And Al-Zain Abu al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman (4) bin Abi Bakr bin Ayyub al-Zur'i, [then al-Dimashqi], in Dhu al-Hijjah.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 336; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 265-266; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 362-363; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 338-339; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 178-179; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 351-352.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 337; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 267; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 391-392; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 339; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 482-483.
3. In the copy: Najib. Correction from his biography sources.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 339; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 269; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 335; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 326. What is between brackets is blurred in the copy, established from his biography sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He was the sole narrator for hearing from Al-Shihab al-Abir, and he heard from Abu Bakr (1) bin Abd al-Da'im, Al-Mut'im, and Al-Hajjar.
538 - And Al-Alam Sanjar (2) Abdullah al-Jazari al-Dimashqi, in Safar. He heard from Al-Abraquhi 'Sifat al-Munafiq' by Al-Faryabi, 'Majlis Rizq Allah al-Tamimi', and others, and narrated.
539 - And in Qabr al-Sitt in the suburbs of Damascus, the Musnid Abd al-Rahim (3) bin Ghanayim al-Tadmuri al-Bayani, in Sha'ban. He attended under Ibn Asakir in his fourth year 'Sahih Muslim', and heard from Ayyub bin al-Nahhas 'Sunan al-Daraqutni'.
540 - And Al-Izz Abu Ya'la Hamza (4) son of Al-Qutb Musa bin Ahmad bin al-Hasan al-Dimashqi, known as Ibn Sheikh al-Salamiyah, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged over sixty.
foot_note:
1. He is: Abu Bakr bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Da'im, the Musnid Sheikh, died in 718 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 334-335; and Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 402-403.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 324; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 242; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 329-330; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 174, as: Sanjar bin Abdullah al-Najmi.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 332-333; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 253-254; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 335-336; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 359-360.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 13: 182-183; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 337-338; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 267-268; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 51; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 328-329; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 77.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard from Al-Hajjar and others.
541 - And in Aleppo, its Musnid Al-Salah Abdullah (1) son of the Muhaddith Shams al-Din Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Ghanayim bin al-Muhandis, on 21 Muharram, aged 78 years. He attended under Umar bin al-Qawwas 'Mu'jam Ibn Jami'', and Al-Taqi al-Wasiti gave him license, among others.
542 - And in it, the Sharif Ali (2) bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman al-Hasani al-Fasi al-Makki al-Maliki, aged 61 years, between the lands of Takrur and Egypt, heading to Takrur. He heard a lot from Al-Tawzari, Al-Safi, Al-Radi al-Tabari, and others.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 321; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 239; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 333-334; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 282.
2. His biography is in: Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 6: 236-237; and Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 186-187.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Seventy (770 AH)
543 - In it, died in Mecca its preacher, Al-Diya' Muhammad (1) bin Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Makarim al-Hamawi al-Makki, while removed from office in Muharram, aged 65 years. (2) Al-Tabari and others.
544 - And in Damascus its judge, Sheikh of the Hanafis Jamal al-Din Mahmud (3) bin al-Siraj Ahmad bin Mas'ud al-Qunawi al-Dimashqi al-Hanafi, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 78 years. He was an expert in his school, Usul, and Arabic. He held the judgeship of [Damascus replacing Judge Sharaf] (4) al-Din al-Kafri, and practiced that for about thirty days, then Al-Kafri returned due to the removal of the one who mediated his dismissal, Amir Sarghatmish. He held it after Al-Kafri's death in the year 66, and continued until he died. He summarized 'Sharh al-Saghnaqi' on 'Al-Hidaya' ... (5) volumes, and he has many works.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 248-249; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 2: 86-89; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 485.
2. Blurred in the copy. In Al-Iqd Al-Thamin and Dhayl Al-Taqyid: He heard from his maternal grandfather Al-Radi Ibrahim bin Muhammad al-Tabari. Then he listed what he heard from him.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 348-349; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 3: 435-436; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 286-287; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 466-467; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 358-359; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 322-323, dating his death at the end of the month or the beginning of the next year.
4. What is between brackets is blurred in the copy, established from Al-Bidaya wa Al-Nihaya 16: 389, 391, in the year 759 AH.
5. Blurred in the copy, and the author of Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah enumerated his works.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
545 - And Imam Shams al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Khalaf bin Kamil al-Ghazzi, in Rajab, aged fifty-odd years. He taught, benefited others, and deputized in judgment for Al-Taj al-Subki, defending him much, and from ... (2).
546 - And the Linguistic Imam, the Memorizer, Al-Badr Muhammad (3) bin al-Jamal Muhammad bin al-Kamal Ahmad al-Sharishi, in Rabi' al-Akhir, aged 46 years. He was a memorizer of linguistic evidences, a compiler in that.
547 - And the Judge of Gaza, Al-Izz Muhammad (4) bin Muhammad bin Mahmud al-Tabrizi, ... (5) the Abode, in Muharram. He cared for knowledge, summarized 'Al-Rawda' and 'Jami' al-Usul'. He heard from Al-Jara'idi, and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Taj al-Din al-Subki 9: 155-156; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 345-346; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 283-284; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 354-355; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 165-166; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 432-433.
2. Blurred in the copy.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 344-345; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 282-283; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 329; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 356-357; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 178-179; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 164-165.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 347-348; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 285-286; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 327; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 357; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 237.
5. Blurred in the copy. In his biography sources: Of Tabrizi origin, born in Jerusalem, Al-Ba'li Al-Shafi'i.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
548 - And Al-Imad Muhammad (1) bin Musa bin Sulayman al-Ansari, Ibn al-Shayraji, in Muharram. He was the sole narrator from Al-Fakhr for hearing 'Juz al-Ansari' ... (2).
549 - Al-Majd Ahmad (3) son of Al-Majd Al-Afif Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Irbili al-Dimashqi, in Dhu al-Qi'dah aged 76 years. He heard from Ibn Musharraf 'Sahih Al-Bukhari', and Ahmad bin Asakir, Umar bin al-Qawwas, Umar (4) bin al-Aqimi, Al-Sharif ... (5), and others gave him license.
550 - And the Musnid Abu al-Hasan Ali (6) bin Uthman bin Umar bin Uthman al-Dimashqi, Ibn al-Harastani, head of the Muezzins at the Umayyad Mosque, in Rabi' al-Akhir.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 340-341; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 278; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 328; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 357-358; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 268-269.
2. Blurred in the copy. In Wafayat Ibn Rafi', Dhayl Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, and Al-Durar Al-Kamina: And he narrated it, and some of his Mashyakha. I say: Meaning Mashyakha Al-Fakhr bin Al-Bukhari.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 346-347; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 284-285; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 167-168, as: Shihab al-Din, known as Ibn al-Majd al-Irbili; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 351-352; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 275.
4. He is: Umar bin Ibrahim bin al-Husayn al-Aqimi, Jamal al-Din, died in 699 AH. Dhayl Mir'at al-Zaman (Abu Dhabi Ed.), p. 409-420; Al-Muqtafi 3: 99-100; and Tarikh Al-Islam 15: 921-922.
5. Blurred in the copy. In Dhayl Al-Taqyid: Al-Sharif Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman al-Husayni al-Misri.
6. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 344; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 282; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 84.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard Ibn al-Mawazini, Ishaq al-Nahhas ... (1).
551 - ... (2) Abdullah bin Tariq al-Salihi, Ibn al-Suqi, aged about ninety years. He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas 'Mu'jam Ibn Jami'' and 'Juz Muhammad bin Yazid bin Abd al-Samad', and under [Al-Izz al-Farra] (3), and a group heard from him, and he narrated.
foot_note:
1. Blurred in the copy. The phrase in Al-Wafayat and Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar is: He heard from Ibn al-Mawazini, Ishaq bin Abi Bakr bin al-Nahhas, and others. He narrated, and had a beautiful voice.
2. Blurred in the copy. Perhaps it is: Muhammad bin Abi Bakr bin Ali al-Dimashqi al-Salihi, known as Ibn al-Suqi, Izz al-Din bin Abdullah. This is what Al-Taqi Al-Fasi mentioned in Dhayl Al-Taqyid, and his biography sources agreed that he was born in 681 or 682 AH, making his age 90 on the day of his death. His hearings and mentioned teachers match what is mentioned here, except that they dated his death to 773 AH, contrary to the author's date here. See his biography in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 385-386; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 330-331; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 185-186; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 409; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 405.
3. Unclear in the margin of the copy, established according to what was mentioned in his biography sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-One (771 AH)
552 - ... The skilled Taj al-Din Abu Nasr Abd al-Wahhab (1) bin Ali bin Abd al-Kafi al-Subki al-Shafi'i, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 43 years. He has numerous works, many virtues, and attained much glory, ... (2).
553 - [195 Verso] And the Chief Judge, the skilled Imam Al-Sharaf Ahmad (3) son of Judge Al-Sharaf Abu al-Fadl al-Hasan bin Abdullah bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi al-Salihi al-Hanbali, Ibn Sheikh al-Jabal, aged close to 78 years. He had much concern for knowledge and acquisition. It is said that Sheikh Taqi al-Din Ibn Taymiyyah permitted him to issue fatwas. Ahmad bin Asakir and Umar bin al-Qawwas gave him license, and he heard from Ismail al-Farra. He has numerous works.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 152; Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 19: 315-316, dying before him; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 362-364; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 303-306; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 374-376; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 372-375; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 425-428. The dotted place is blurred in the copy, perhaps: The Imam or The Jurist.
2. Two unreadable words, perhaps their outline is: And was harmed also.
3. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 16, and the date of death was appended in the printed version by one of the annotators; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 354; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 294-295; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 38-39; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 343-344; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 364-366; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 120-121.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
554 - And in Cairo, Chief Judge Umar (1) bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Bakr bin Fath al-Bistami, al-Misri, al-Hanafi, while removed from office, in Jumada al-Akhirah. He memorized 'Al-Hidaya' for Hanafis, and taught it repeatedly.
555 - And Chief Judge Jamal al-Din Muhammad (2) bin Abd al-Rahim bin Ali bin Abd al-Malik al-Masallati al-Maliki, in Dhu al-Qi'dah, having exceeded seventy. He deputized in the judgeship of Damascus for Al-Sharaf al-Hamadani al-Maliki, then held it after him until during the year (55), then was removed by Al-Sharaf Ahmad bin Asakir al-Baghdadi, then returned to it in the year sixty after the removal of the aforementioned Al-Sharaf, and continued until Ramadan of the year (67). Then he was removed by Ismail bin Hani', then returned after about sixty days, and continued until he died. Ibn Rafi' compiled a 'Mashyakha' for him from a group including: Al-Hajjar and Abd al-Rahman bin Makhluf. And in Damascus, the Musnids:
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 355; Al-Jawahir Al-Mudiyyah 2: 648-649; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 295-296; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 223, with his death date as 791 AH incorrectly; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 563; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 375-376; Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 169; and Raf' al-Isr, p. 292.
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 360; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 300-301; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 269-270; Ghayat Al-Nihaya fi Tabaqat Al-Qurra 2: 171; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 188; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 377; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 11-12.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
556 - Al-Shihab Ahmad (1) bin Muhammad bin Umar bin Husayn al-Ayiki, the pure Persian, al-Salihi, [known as] Zaghlash, in Muharram, aged 93 years. He heard from Al-Fakhr 'Muntaqa min Mashyakhat Ibn al-Bast', the third of 'Fawa'id al-Ikhshid', and a piece of 'Al-Hilyah'.
557 - And the centenarian Ibrahim (2) bin Muhammad [bin] Azzaz al-A'zazi al-Salihi ..., in Shawwal, having exceeded eighty by a little. He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas some of 'Amal al-Yawm wa al-Laylah' by Ibn al-Sunni.
558 - And the Just Witness Ahmad (3) bin Ali bin Yusuf bin al-Muhtar, of Egyptian origin, Damascene, Imam of Masjid al-Ra's, in Rabi' al-Akhir, aged 65 years. He heard from Al-Hajjar.
559 - And Ali (4) bin Shafi' bin Hajras, cousin of Hafiz Taqi al-Din bin Rafi', in Shawwal, aged seventy years. He narrated from Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Da'im.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 350-351; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 290-291; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 177; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 1: 272; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 367; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 290.
2. His biography is in: Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 62, and the dotted place is blurred in the copy.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 353; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 293; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 367; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 224.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 358; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 299; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 55.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
560 - And Abu Bakr (1) - also called Diya' - bin Muhammad bin Nasr Allah al-Kafr Batna'i al-Fakihi, in Shawwal, in the tenth of the seventies. He is the brother of Hafiz Al-Dhahabi's wife. He attended in the year (11) under Hadiyah (2) bint Askar 'Al-Ilm' by Al-Marwazi.
561 - And Muhammad (3) bin Abdullah bin Al-Izz Ali bin Abi al-Sinan al-Sinani al-Mawsili, al-Dimashqi, the Cloth Merchant, in Dhu al-Qi'dah. He heard from Abu Nasr al-Shirazi 'Juz al-Qazzaz'. He was benevolent and serene.
562 - And Al-Izz Abu al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman (4) bin Ahmad bin Al-Sharaf Umar bin Muhammad al-Sulami al-Misri al-Dimashqi, Ibn al-Sukkari, in Dhu al-Hijjah. He heard from Wazira, and Al-Abraquhi, Ibn Daqiq al-Eid, and Al-Dimyati gave him license.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 357-358; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 298-299; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 210-211.
2. She is: Hadiyah bint Ali bin Askar al-Baghdadi al-Labban, Al-Harras is her father, died in 712 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 73-74; Mu'jam Al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 362-363; and A'yan al-Asr 5: 542.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 358-359; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 300; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 478-479.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 364-365; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 306; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 476; and Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 372.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Two (772 AH)
563 - In it, died in Mecca its reciter, Yahya (1) bin Ahmad bin Ahmad bin Safwan al-Qaysi al-Andalusi al-Maliqi. He deputized in the Maqam for Sheikh Khalil, and dedicated himself to teaching recitation in Mecca. He narrated from Abu Muhammad Abdullah (2) bin Ayyub, and others.
564 - And in Medina, its Muhaddith, Judge, and Man of Letters, Abu al-Hasan Ali (3) bin Yusuf bin al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Mahmud bin Abdullah al-Ansari al-Zarandi al-Hanafi, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged about 65 years. He cared for Hadith, Fiqh, and Literature, excelled in these sciences, participated in others, and had good poetry. He used to memorize a quarter of 'Al-Wajiz' in the Shafi'i school, then became a Hanafi.
565 - And in Cairo, its Jurist, the Skilled Scholar Abd al-Rahim (4) bin al-Hasan bin Ali bin
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Irshad Al-Talibin ila Shuyukh Qadi Al-Qudah Ibn Zahira Jamal al-Din, p. 73; Al-Iqd Al-Thamin 7: 427-429; Ghayat Al-Nihaya 2: 365; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 410.
2. He is: Abdullah bin Ayyub bin Yusuf bin Qudamah al-Maqdisi, died in 735 AH. Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 250.
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bi al-Wafayat 22: 356; A'yan al-Asr 3: 584-585; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 380-381; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 325-326; Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 199; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 476-478; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 391; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 3: 142-143.
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 370-372; Al-Iqd Al-Mudhahhab fi Tabaqat Hamalat Al-Madhhab, p. 410; Hafiz Zayn al-Din al-Iraqi devoted a separate part to his biography; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 314-317; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 230-234; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 387-389; his Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah 3: 132-135; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 354-356.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
Umar al-Isnawi, al-Qurashi, al-Misri, al-Shafi'i, in Jumada al-Ula, aged 68 years. He had vast knowledge of Fiqh, was skilled in the two foundations (Usul) and Arabic, and had great famous works. Among his teachers in Fiqh were: Al-Qutb (1) al-Sunbati, Al-Jamal (2) al-Wajizi, Al-Ala' al-Qunawi, and Al-Taqi al-Subki, and from Al-Qunawi he took Usul. Among his teachers in Arabic was Abu Hayyan. He heard from Al-Dabbusi what he heard of 'Al-Qana'ah' by Ibn Abi al-Dunya, and he narrated, taught, issued fatwas, and students crowded around him.
566 - And Judge Ala' al-Din Ali (3) bin Ismail bin Ibrahim al-Bahnasi, Ibn al-Zarif. He heard Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated.
567 - And Al-Badr Hasan (4) bin Muhammad bin Salih al-Nabulusi, al-Misri, al-Hanbali.
foot_note:
1. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Samad bin Abd al-Qadir al-Sunbati, Qutb al-Din, died in 722 AH. Tabaqat Al-Shafi'iyyah by Al-Isnawi 2: 72-73.
2. He is: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Sulayman al-Wasiti, known as Al-Wajizi, Jamal al-Din, died in 727 AH. Previous Source 2: 555-556.
3. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Taqyid 3: 136.
4. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam Al-Mukhtass bi Al-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 287; Al-Wafayat by Ibn Rafi' 2: 373-374; Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 318-319; Ghayat Al-Nihaya fi Tabaqat Al-Qurra 2: 231; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 14-15; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 386; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 36-37.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Tail on Al-Ibar)
text:
He heard Al-Dabbusi and a group, and claimed hearing from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, but did not hear from them. He cared for Hadith and Fiqh. He authored his 'Fihris' for Abu Hayyan.
568 - And the Just Witness Umar (1) bin al-Hasan bin al-Furat al-Misri al-Hanafi, signatory of the Judgment, aged eighty-six years. He heard Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated.
569 - And Muhammad (2) son of Hafiz Qutb al-Din Abd al-Karim bin Abd al-Nur al-Halabi, in Jumada al-Akhirah. He heard from Al-Alam Ahmad (3) bin Durada, and attended under Hasan al-Kurdi, Wazira, and Al-Hajjar, and narrated.
570 - And Al-Sharaf Muhammad bin al-Husayn bin Umar al-Uthmani al-Maraghi al-Misri, brother of our Sheikh Abu Bakr bin al-Husayn al-Madani. He heard Al-Dabbusi and others, and narrated. He was the controller of the Diwan of Endowments (Ahbas) in Cairo.
foot_note:
1. He is: Umar bin al-Hasan bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Aziz bin al-Furat. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl ala Al-Ibar by Al-Wali Al-Iraqi, p. 327; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 2: 447-448; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhba 2: 392; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 2: 159.
2. His biography is in: Dhayl Al-Taqyid 1: 276-277; Durar Al-Uqud Al-Farida 3: 189; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 4: 23.
3. He is: Ahmad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Abd al-Karim, known as Ibn al-Sarraj al-Misri, died in 718 AH, or it is said 719 AH. Dhayl Al-Taqyid 2: 79-80; and Al-Durar Al-Kamina 1: 167.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 571 - The long-lived Muhammad (1) bin Hamad bin Abd al-Mun'im bin Ahmad bin Abi al-Fath al-Harrani, known as Ibn al-Bayyi' the Merchant, in Rabi' al-Akhir, having exceeded ninety. He heard from Sitt al-Dar (2) bint al-Majd bin Taymiyyah "Juz' al-Banyasi" in the year eighty-something, and from Abd al-Wasi' (3) al-Abhari a small piece of "Maghazi Ibn Ishaq", narration of Yunus bin Bukayr. It was found in the handwriting of al-Birzali among those who heard "Sunan Abi Dawud" from Fakhr Muhammad bin Abd al-Mun'im al-Bayyi', and perhaps it is this one, and his father's name was dropped. Umar bin al-Qawwas and Ahmad bin Asakir gave him license (Ijaza). 572 - And the Khatib (preacher) of Bayt Lahia, Muhammad (4) bin Abdullah bin Malik al-Ajluni al-Dimashqi, having approached eighty. Ahmad bin Asakir and Umar bin al-Qawwas gave him license in the year 45, and he narrated "Thulathiyat al-Bukhari" from Wazira.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 368-369; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 313-314; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 182; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 393-394; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 431. 
2. She is: Sitt al-Dar bint Abd al-Salam bin Abdullah Ibn Taymiyyah al-Harrani, died in the year 686 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 111; Tarikh al-Islam 15: 570. 
3. He is: Abd al-Wasi' bin Abd al-Kafi bin Abd al-Wasi' al-Abhari, Shams al-Din, died in the year 690 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 254-255; Tarikh al-Islam 15: 663. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 370; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 317; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 394; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 480.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 573 - The Musnid (narrator with chain) Abu al-Hasan Ali (1) bin Ismail bin Qarqeen al-Ba'li, on the eve of Eid al-Fitr, in Damascus. He attended with Zaynab bint Kindi "Juz' Dawud bin Rashid" and "Juz' Ibn Nujayd" in the fifth [year], and he heard "Sunan al-Daraqutni" from Taj Abd al-Khaliq with some omissions, and he narrated. 574 - And Abu al-Hasan Ali (2) bin Umar bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Mu'min (3) al-Suri, then al-Salihi, [in Jumada] al-Akhira. He heard from his grandfather on his father's side Ahmad bin Abd al-Rahman, Ismail al-Farra', and a group, and he narrated. Deafness occurred to him. 575 - And the virtuous Shihab Ahmad (4) bin Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Awad al-Maqdisi al-Salihi, son of the Muhtasib (market inspector) the perfumer, at the beginning of Rajab, aged 77 years.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 377-378; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 323-324; Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 137; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 390; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 24. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 373; Irshad al-Talibin ila Shuyukh Qadi al-Qudah Ibn Zahira Jamal al-Din, p. 37; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 318; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 483-484; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 391; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 87; Al-Maqsad al-Arshad 2: 244-245. The text in brackets is smudged in the manuscript, and the affirmation is from biography sources. 
3. In some sources: Abd al-Mu'min. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 374-375; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 319-320; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 271-272, titled: Sharaf al-Din; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 385; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 275-276.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard from Isa al-Mughari and Ibn al-Mawazini, and he narrated, and was prolific. 576 - And Al-Sharaf Abu Bakr (1) bin Abd al-Dayim bin Abd al-Hamid al-Dunaysiri al-Dimashqi, the Naqib (Chief) of the Turbaned [Scholars], in Ramadan, aged 77 years. He heard from Ibn Musharraf some of his "Mashyakha" (list of teachers) - the Takhrīj (extraction) of Ibn al-Sayrafi, and he narrated. 577 - And the Imam of Egypt for a period, and the Khatib of the outer Shamiyyah, Qasim (2) bin Muhammad bin Ghazi al-Turkumani al-Salihi therein. He heard from Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Dayim and narrated. 578 - And the son of the Judge of Zur', the upright Ahmad (3) bin Yahya bin Ishaq al-Shaybani al-Dimashqi. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Wazira. 579 - And the Khatib of Baalbek, Abu Dharr Muhammad (4) bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahim bin Abd al-Wahhab al-Sulami al-Ba'li therein.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 377; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 323; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 447, listed as: Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Karim bin Abd al-Hamid; Lahz al-Alhaz, p. 157, listed as presented here. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 367-368; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 311; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 393; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 236-327. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 380; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 326-327; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 200-201; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 328-329, dating his death in Dhu al-Hijjah of that year. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, pp. 258-259; Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 378-379; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 324-325; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 389; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 395; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 186.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard from Al-Hajjar and Abu Bakr (1) bin Antar, and he narrated. He was religious. 580 - [And in it in Nablus] its Musnid (narrator), the long-lived Abu Ishaq Ibrahim (2) bin Abdullah bin Ahmad al-Nabulusi al-Zitawi, in Rajab or Sha'ban. He was unique in hearing "Sunan Ibn Majah" from Abd al-Hafiz (3) bin Badran, from Al-Muwaffaq (4) Ibn Qudamah, and he narrated it more than once. 581 - And in Alexandria, Imam Shihab al-Din Ahmad (5) bin Muhammad al-Umari al-Hanafi, Ibn Zubaybah al-Iskandari, its Judge. He was concerned with Fiqh (jurisprudence) and other subjects, and held the judgeship of Alexandria, and before that the deputyship of judgment in Cairo.
foot_note:
1. He is: Abu Bakr bin Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Ali bin Antar al-Sulami, Najm al-Din, died in 738 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 3: 1048; Dhayl al-Ibar by Al-Dhahabi, pp. 200-201; Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 1: 203-204.
