2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 376; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 321; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 229; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 80-81; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 384, listing him as: ... al-Ramthawi; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 29. 
3. Abd al-Hafiz bin Badran bin Shibl bin Tarkhan, Imad al-Din, died in 698 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 1: 457; Al-Muqtafi 2: 603-604; Tarikh al-Islam 15: 874. 
4. He is: Abdullah bin Ahmad bin Muhammad Ibn Qudamah, Muwaffaq al-Din, died in 620 AH. Al-Takmila li-Wafiyat al-Naqala 3: 107; Tarikh al-Islam 14: 601-611. 
5. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 376; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 321-322; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 356; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 384-385; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 94, the last three list him as: Ahmad bin Ibrahim bin Umar.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: The Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Three (773 AH) 582 - In it, the Scholar Abu Zakariya Yahya (1), known as Al-Rahuni, the Maghrebi Maliki, resident of Cairo, died in Cairo on the third of Shawwal. He had good knowledge of Fiqh and the two principles (Usul al-Fiqh and Usul al-Din). He taught Fiqh at the Shaykhuniyyah and Mansuriyyah [schools], and Hadith at the Sarghatmishiyyah. 583 - And the Chief Justice, Sharaf al-Din Umar (2) bin Ishaq bin Ahmad al-Hindi al-Qunawi al-Hanafi, on the 7th of Rajab. He was knowledgeable in Fiqh and the two principles. He authored a commentary on "Al-Hidayah" and on "Badi'" by Ibn al-Sa'ati, and attained great prestige with the state. He heard from Al-Qutb al-Halabi and others from the companions of Al-Najib. 584 - And Sitt al-Khutaba (3) bint al-Taqi Ali bin Abd al-Kafi al-Subki.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dibaj al-Mudhahhab 2: 362, dating his death to 774 AH or 775 AH; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 421; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 32. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 389-390; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 336-338; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 436-439; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 405-406; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 154-155; Raf' al-Isr, pp. 288-289; Taj al-Tarajim, pp. 223-224. 
3. Her biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 387-388; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 332-333; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 403; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 126, dating her death in Jumada al-Akhira.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: She heard the first part of "Hadith Sufyan" from Ali bin al-Qayyim, and heard his audible narrations of "Sunan al-Nasa'i" from Ali bin al-Sawwaf, and she narrated in Gaza and Homs. 585 - And Shams al-Din [Muhammad (1) bin Musa bin Yasin] al-Hawwari al-Shafi'i. He heard "Al-Sunan" by Ibn Abi Dawud from Al-Hajjar, and "Hikayat" (Stories) of Ibrahim bin Adham, and the second part of "Hadith Tirad", and he narrated. 586 - And Judge Al-Badr Muhammad (2) bin Muhammad bin Ya'qub al-Dimashqi, Ibn al-Jawashni, [aged about] seventy. He heard "Juz' Hilal al-Haffar" from Isa al-Mut'im and Abu Bakr bin Abd al-Dayim. He was concerned with knowledge and was religious. 587 - And the littérateur Yahya (3) bin Muhammad bin Zakariya bin Muhammad al-Amiri, known as Ibn al-Khabbaz al-Baladi al-Hamawi.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 383-384; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 329-330; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 458; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 330-331; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 408-409; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 271. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 384-385; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 330; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 408; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 242. Text in brackets is an addition required by context, as the spot was smudged, matching the birth date in sources. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 28: 315-321; Alhan al-Sawaji' 2: 337-340; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 343-344; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 520-521; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 409; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 426.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He mentioned that he [was born in the year six hundred seventy-seven in Muharram in Hama] (1), as narrated by Al-Safadi, who said: He had deep insight into beautiful meanings and was extreme in Shi'ism. Al-Badr bin Habib recited [poetry] of his: [Sari' meter] 'Wake up to the bride of the garden and unveil her ... And divorce sadness thrice [irrevocably with coffee that is sweet to us as] (3) ... The pearls of rain are sweet to the neck of daughters.' 588 - And the Musnid Najm al-Din Ahmad (2) bin al-Najm Ismail bin Ahmad bin Umar bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi al-Salihi, in Jumada al-Akhira, aged 91. He attended "[Amali] Ibn Sam'un" with Fakhr bin al-Bukhari, and "Arba'in al-Hakim" with Al-Taqi al-Wasiti, and he narrated. 589 - And the Khatib of the Muzaffari Mosque, Abu al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman (3) bin al-Izz Muhammad bin al-Khatib al-Izz Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Abi Umar al-Maqdisi, aged 75. He heard [Al-Hasan al-Khallal and Isa] (4) al-Mughari ...
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript, affirmation from Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 387; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 332; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 21; Ghayat al-Nihaya 1: 39; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah (twice) 1: 176, 268-269; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 400-401; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 105-106. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 386-387; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 331-332; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 255-256; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 404; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 340. 
4. Text in brackets is smudged in manuscript, affirmation from Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi; dots indicate smudge in manuscript.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 590 - And Emir Rukn al-Din Umar (1) bin Arghun, his father was the Deputy of the Sultanate in Egypt. He heard in Cairo from Al-Hajjar and Wazira when his father brought them there, and heard in Mecca from Al-Radi al-Tabari. He held the deputyship of Safad and Karak, ... (2). 591 - [Shihab al-Din, Abu al-Abbas Ahmad (3) bin Muhammad bin] / [196a] Hashim bin Asha'ir al-Halabi, in Rajab, aged seventy-eight. He heard much from Sunqur. 592 - And the Judge of Homs, Abu al-Ghayth, Al-Kamal Muhammad (4) bin Al-Taqi Abdullah Ibn Qadi Halab Taqi al-Din Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Khaliq bin al-Sa'igh al-Ansari ... (5) al-Shafi'i, aged 46. He heard Al-Hajjar, Asma' bint Satra, and others.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 393-394; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 340-341; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 405; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 154. 
2. Smudged in manuscript; in Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar: He held the deputyship of Karak, Gaza, and Safad. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 391; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 333; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 212; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 403; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 304-305; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 23-24. Text in brackets is smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 394-395; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 341-342; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 330; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 407; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 484-485. 
5. Smudged in manuscript, perhaps: Al-Dimashqi, as in Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah and Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: Shams al-Din bin Sa'd extracted a "Mashyakha" for him, and he narrated. 593 - In Mecca, the skilled Imam, Judge Baha' al-Din (1) - also called Tamam - bin Al-Taqi Ali bin Abd al-Kafi al-Subki al-Shafi'i, author of "Arus al-Afrah" and "Sharh Talkhis al-Miftah", in Rajab aged 55. He was skilled in Fiqh, Usul, Arabic, and literature, and had good poetry. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar in Cairo, and narrated. Along with knowledge, he was extremely clever, as was his father. 594 - In Mecca, Abu al-Fatah Yusuf (2) bin al-Hasan bin Ali al-Sijzi al-Hanafi al-Makki, Imam of the Maqam (Station). He adopted Sufism at the hands of Sheikh Ahmad al-Ahdal al-Yamani, and put a basket around his neck and went around houses ... (3) people, to humble his ego thereby. He had great concern for the standing at the Maqam of the Hanafis, disregarding people's disapproval of it.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, pp. 29-30; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, Takhrij al-Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, pp. 102-105; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 7: 246-252; Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 388-389; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 334-336; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 316-317; Al-Iqd al-Thamin 3: 383-386, listed as: Tamam; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 250-256; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 401-402; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 103-106; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 210-216. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Iqd al-Thamin 8: 81-82; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 235. 
3. Smudged in manuscript, perhaps meaning: to show him.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: The Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Four (774 AH) 595 - In it, in Damascus, died the Hafiz Taqi al-Din, Abu al-Ma'ali [Muhammad (1) bin] Rafi' al-Sallami - with doubled Lam - al-Sumaydi al-Hawrani al-Misri al-Dimashqi, aged seventy save a few months. He heard with his father's care from Ali bin al-Sawwaf his audible narrations of "Sunan al-Nasa'i", and from many people. He authored, taught, and narrated. He was afflicted with OCD (Waswas) such that he would not [walk] (2) in the streets except with his clothes tucked up high. 596 - And the Hafiz, Abu al-Fida Ismail (3) bin Umar bin Kathir bin [Daw' bin Kathir] al-Ja'fari al-Basrawi (4) al-Dimashqi al-Shafi'i, in Sha'ban, aged about 74.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, pp. 229-230; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 3: 68-69; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 352-355; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 212-213; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 182-184; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 421-423; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 166-169; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 439-440. 
2. Smudged in manuscript, the affirmation is more fitting to context. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, pp. 74-75; Dhayl Tadhkirat al-Huffaz by Al-Husayni, pp. 57-59; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 358-360; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 289-290; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 400-401; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 416-417; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 113-115; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 373-374. Text in brackets is smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources. 
4. In biography sources: Al-Busrawi.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He was concerned with Hadith and Tafsir (Exegesis). He heard from Isa [al-Mut'im] (1) and Al-Hajjar. He authored a large book compiling the Sunan (2) and the schools of scholars, in which he gathered from the Six Books, "Musnad Ahmad", "Mu'jam al-Tabarani al-Kabir", "Musnad al-Bazzar", and "Musnad Abi Ya'la", following the arrangement of Al-Mizzi's "Atraf". He used to issue fatwas according to Ibn Taymiyyah's position on divorce, and was tested because of it. 597 - And the skilled Muhaddith Abu Tahir Ahmad (3) bin Muhammad bin Ali bin Sa'id bin Salim al-Ansari, Ibn Imam al-Mashhad, aged forty. He attended Zaynab bint [al-Kamal] (4) and Al-Jazari. He was concerned with Hadith, excelled in it, and performed Takhrij. 598 - And the unique Imam [Shams al-Din] al-Mawsili, Muhammad (5) bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Karim al-Ba'li, possessor of great capability in literature.
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources, and I identified what he heard from him as Musnad al-Darimi. 
2. It is: Jami' al-Masanid wal-Sunan. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 357; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 415; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 38; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 282. 
4. Dropped from manuscript. She is: Zaynab bint Ahmad bin Abd al-Rahim, known as Bint al-Kamal, died in 740 AH. Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 248; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 117-118. 
5. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 1: 262-269; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 355; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 386-389; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 424; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 188; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 52-53. Text in brackets is smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 599 - And Al-Baha', Abu al-Mahasin Yusuf (1) bin Muhammad bin Yusuf bin Ahmad bin Ali al-Qurashi, Ibn al-Zaki, at the beginning of Rabi' al-Awwal. Al-Rashid bin Abi al-Qasim, the Musnid of Baghdad, gave him license, and he narrated. 600 - ... Tahir (2) bin Abi Bakr al-Tabrizi al-Dimashqi. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar, Al-Jazari, and Al-Mizzi, and narrated. 601 - And Al-Shams Muhammad (3) bin Ahmad bin Abi Bakr bin Abd al-Samad bin Marjan al-Salihi, the Quran reciter, the Hanbali, aged about seventy. He heard from Judge Sulayman bin Hamza ... (4), and from Isa al-Mut'im his "Mashyakha", and narrated. 602 - And the Musnid Umar (5) bin Ibrahim bin Nasr bin Ibrahim bin Abdullah al-Kinani al-Salihi al-Hanbali al-Naqbi, having reached eighty or exceeded it, in Dhu al-Qa'dah.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 399-400; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 349; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 427-428; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 476-477; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 55. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 397-398; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 347-348; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 401; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 419, listing him as: Zafir; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 43. The dotted area is smudged in manuscript, his title in sources is: Najm al-Din. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 358; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 283; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 421; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 373; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 47; Al-Maqsad al-Arshad 2: 365-366. 
4. Smudged in manuscript, in biography sources: Heard from - or narrated from - Sulayman bin Hamza, Yahya bin Sa'd, and Isa al-Mut'im. 
5. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 208; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 439-440; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 148.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard from Umar bin al-Qawwas "Mu'jam Ibn Jami'" and "Juz' Muhammad bin Yazid bin Abd al-Samad", and from Al-Izz Ismail al-Farra' "Akhlaq al-Nabi (PBUH)" by Judge Ismail, and he narrated. 603 - In Aleppo, the Musnid Zahir al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Abd al-Karim bin Muhammad al-Ajami al-Halabi, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 80. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" and "Sunan Ibn Majah" from Sunqur, and ... (2) "Mashyakha Ibn Shadhan al-Kubra", and narrated. 604 - And Shams al-Din Muhammad (3) son of Judge Fakhr al-Din Uthman bin Musa bin Ali al-Halabi, Ibn al-Aqrab al-Hanafi, aged sixty-something. He was concerned with knowledge and excelled in it, held the professorship at the Qilijiyyah (4) and the Atabakiyyah (5) in Aleppo, and people benefited from him.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 345-346; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 277-278; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah (twice) 3: 190, 332-333; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 423; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 24; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 50. 
2. Smudged in manuscript. In Dhayl al-Taqyid and Al-Durar al-Kamina: He heard the mentioned Mashyakha from Baybars al-Adimi. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 361-362; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 332; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 423; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 44; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 51. 
4. Established by Emir Mujahid al-Din Muhammad bin Mahmud bin Qilij al-Nuri, construction finished 650 AH. Al-A'laq al-Khatira (Aleppo Section), Vol 1: Part 1: 280. 
5. Established by Shihab al-Din Tughril al-Atabak, freedman of King Al-Zahir Ghiyath al-Din Ghazi, construction finished 618 AH. Previous Source, Vol 1: Part 1: 272.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 605 - ... Al-Shihab Ahmad (1) bin Muhammad bin Jum'ah al-Ansari al-Halabi, in Muharram, aged about 76. He heard "Juz' Muhammad bin al-Faraj al-Azraq" from Al-Taj (2) bin al-Nasibi. 606 - And Judge Fakhr al-Din Uthman (3) bin Muhammad bin Isa bin Ali bin Wahb al-Qushayri, Ibn Daqiq al-Eid ... al-Shafi'i. He heard the first part of "Mashyakha Ibn al-Jummaysi" from his relative Al-Taj Ahmad bin Daqiq al-Eid. 607 - And Al-Badr al-Hasan (4) bin Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Karim al-Ansari al-Tustarawi, then al-Misri, al-Shadhili, al-Shafi'i, Ibn Abd al-Aziz (5), ... (6) and sixty years.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 360-361; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 263; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 414-415; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 260. Dots indicate smudge in manuscript. 
2. He is: Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Muhammad, Taj al-Din, known as Ibn al-Nasibi, the Musnid Sheikh, died in 715 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 207; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 153-154. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafiyat by Ibn Rafi 2: 401; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 349-350; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 420; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 45. Dots indicate smudge in manuscript. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 363-364; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 329-330; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 12; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 418-419; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 18-19; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 42. 
5. Biography sources mention he was known by his father's name. 
6. Smudged in manuscript. In Dhayl al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi: About sixty-something years. Ibn Habib specified it, and Al-Maqrizi quoted him in Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah as 67 years.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard from Abd al-Rahman bin Makhluf "Al-Muhaddith al-Fadil", and from Muhammad (1) bin Abd al-Majid bin al-Sawwaf "Al-Tawakkul" by Ibn Abi al-Dunya, and he narrated "Al-Sahih" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira. Sheikh Zayn al-Din al-Iraqi said: He did not hear from either of them. 608 - In it in Baghdad, ... Marjan (2) the Servant/Eunuch. He held its deputyship for Qan Uways, then rebelled against him and took it over. Uways marched on him, then schemed against him until he captured him and employed him in herding geese, then he was pleased with him after that and made him Deputy of Baghdad. 609 - At its end, or in 75 ..., Al-Badr Muhammad (3) bin Ali bin Ismail al-Zawali, al-Misri, as a martyr killed in Cairo, aged 75. He heard "Al-Sahih" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated. 610 - In it or in the one after it, the Scholar Muhaddith Muhyi al-Din Abd al-Qadir (4) bin [Muhammad] bin Muhammad bin Salim al-Qurashi, al-Misri, al-Hanafi, having approached eighty.
foot_note:
1. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Majid bin Khalaf, Sadid bin al-Sawwaf. Died 723 AH. Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 26. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 345; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 54. 
3. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 300; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 58; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 51, listed there as: Al-Zawawi. Dots indicate smudge in manuscript. 
4. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 64-65; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 315-316; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 392; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 66.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf his audible narrations of "Sunan al-Nasa'i", and from Hasan al-Kurdi "Muwatta' Ibn Bukayr", and from many people. He authored beautiful works, narrated, and changed slightly at the end, and became blind. 611 - In it in Cairo, Arshad al-Din Abu al-Thana' Mahmud (1) bin Qutlushah al-Sara'i al-Hanafi, aged eighty-something. He was knowledgeable in Usul, Arabic, Wisdom (Philosophy), and Medicine, inclined towards isolation and withdrawal. 612 - ... The Judge of Taybah (Medina), Al-Badr Ibrahim (2) son of Judge Sadr al-Din Ahmad bin al-Majd Isa al-Khashshab, al-Misri, aged 77. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, except the first session, and "Sahih Muslim" from Musa al-Musawi, and the first part of "Awali Sunan al-Bayhaqi", and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 371; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 442; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 332; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 70. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 370-371; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 213-214; Al-Muqaffa al-Kabir 1: 108; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 71-72; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 437; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 12-13; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 64. Dots indicate a word partly smudged, possibly: Al-Tur (The Mountain), sources differ on death location, some say the Red Sea returning to Medina, buried in some islands, Inba' al-Ghumr says: On the road between Yanbu and Al-Uyun.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He held the judgeship of Aleppo, then was dismissed and returned to Egypt, where he deputized for Ibn Jama'ah. Then he held the judgeship of Medina, its sermon (Khitaba), and Imamate. Then he returned to the deputyship of Cairo, then held Medina for a few years contiguous with his death. 613 - Outside Damascus, Zaynab (1) bint Qasim bin Abd al-Hamid bin Ahmad al-Damanisi al-Ajamiyyah al-Dimashqiyyah, aged about ninety. She heard from Al-Fakhr his "Mashyakha al-Zahiriyyah" (2). And she narrated.
foot_note:
1. Her biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 414; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 89; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 121; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 65. 
2. i.e., Takhrij of Hafiz Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abdullah al-Zahiri.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: The Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Six (776 AH) 614 - In it in Cairo, its Judge Sadr al-Din [Muhammad (1) son of the Chief] Justice Al-Jamal Abdullah son of Judge Ali bin Uthman bin Mustafa bin al-Turkumani al-Hanafi al-Misri, aged eighty-three years and months. He was concerned with knowledge, was virtuous, held the judgeship of the Army (Askar) in Cairo, then the Chief Justiceship after the death of Al-Siraj al-Hindi ... (2). He had beautiful qualities and good poetry. From it, after an eye infection (Ophthalmia) afflicted him: [Wafir meter] 'I flee to darkness with all effort ... As if the light seeks me for a debt. And light has no demand, but I ... See it truly as the demand of my eye.' 615 - ... The Skilled Al-Shams Muhammad (3) bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ali bin al-Hasan bin al-Sa'igh, al-Hanafi, in Sha'ban aged 68.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 383-385; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 254-255; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 468; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 477-478; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 94; Raf' al-Isr, p. 374. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources. 
2. Smudged in manuscript. In Dhayl al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi and Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah: He continued for three years and months until he died. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 3: 244-245; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 377-378; Ghayat al-Nihaya 2: 163-164; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 255-260; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 468-469; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 499-400; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 95-96; Taj al-Tarajim, p. 266.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He was concerned with arts of knowledge. His Sheikh in Arabic was Abu Hayyan, and in Readings Al-Taqi al-Sa'igh. He heard Al-Hajjar and Yunus al-Dabbusi. (1) He taught, issued fatwas, and held the judgeship of the Army for the Hanafis. He has poetry of the highest peak. 616 - And Al-Badr Hasan (2) bin Ali bin Ismail al-Qunawi, al-Shafi'i, al-Misri, Sheikh of Sa'id al-Su'ada'. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar, and "Juz' Ibn Makhlad", and before that ... (3). He authored in seriousness and jest. 617 - In Damascus, its Judge Al-Sharaf Ahmad (4) son of its Judge Al-Shihab Al-Husayn bin Sulayman bin Fazara bin al-Kafri al-Dimashqi, al-Hanafi, while removed from office, in Safar aged 85.
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript, context likely: He gained understanding in Fiqh, or excelled, as both words appear with this sentence in his biography sources. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 379-380; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 333; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 12-13; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 458; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 20-21; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 84. 
3. Smudged in manuscript. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 389; Ghayat al-Nihaya 1: 48-49; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 369; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 453; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 125; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 79.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: [He took] (1) Readings from his father, and taught after him at Al-Tarkhaniyyah (2). He deputized for him in judgment in Damascus, and held its judgeship after him. He continued until he was replaced by Ibn al-Sarraj in the year 59, then returned after about thirty days, and continued ... (3), he turned to his affairs, benefiting others and being read to. He was given license in the year of his birth by Al-Taqi al-Wasiti, Umar bin al-Qawwas, Ahmad bin Asakir, and Al-Taj bin Abi Asrun. He heard from Isa al-Mughari and others. 618 - [In it, Imam Abu al-Abbas Ahmad (4) bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Ali al-Asbahi al-Annabi], aged sixty-something. He attended Abu Hayyan in Egypt and took Arabic from him, excelling in it, and he explained "Al-Tashil" (5), and notables took from him.
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript, likely affirmation is correct, as Ibn Hajar mentioned in his books, and in Ghayat al-Nihaya: He read to his father. 
2. Established by Hajj Nasir al-Dawla Tarkhan, or said to be endowed by Sunqur al-Mawsili for the followers of Abu Hanifa. Al-A'laq al-Khatira (Damascus Section) Vol 1: Part 1: 201; Al-Daris fi Tarikh al-Madaris 1: 539-542. 
3. Smudged in manuscript. In Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah - closer to author's phrasing: He was removed in Sha'ban year 59, then reinstated, then left the judiciary and positions to his son Judge Jamal al-Din in Jumada year 63, ... and turned to his affairs ... 
4. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, deduced from rest of biography and consensus of sources in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 392; Ghayat al-Nihaya 1: 125, 128; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 377; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 454-455; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 298; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 80. 
5. In his biography sources - except Ibn Hajar in his books - it states he explained Kitab Sibawayh, while Ibn Hajar attributed to him the explanation of Al-Tashil.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 619 - And its reciter, Al-Shams Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Ali bin Rajab bin [al-Labban], aged sixty-something. He was skilled in Readings; among his teachers in it was Abu Hayyan. He heard from Al-Hajjar and a group. 620 - And the son of the Judge of Zabadani, Judge Imam Al-Jamal Muhammad (2) bin al-Hasan bin Umar ..., aged 89 and a half. He was skilled in Fiqh. Al-Kamal bin al-Zamlakani authorized him to issue fatwas and he learned Fiqh from him and Al-Burhan (3) bin al-Firkah. He heard from Ibn Maktum (4) and Wazira, and narrated. 621 - And Al-Sharif [Muhammad (5) bin al-Hasan bin Abdullah al-Husayni, al-Wasiti], aged 55 years (6).
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 393; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 95; Ghayat al-Nihaya 2: 72-73; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 350; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 464-465; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 340-341; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 89-90. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from sources consensus. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 389-390; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 200-201; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 181-182; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 466-467; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 163-164; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 423-424; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 90-91. Dots indicate smudge in manuscript, his name in sources is: Muhammad bin Hasan bin Muhammad bin Ammar bin Mutawwij bin Jarir. 
3. He is: Ibrahim bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ibrahim al-Fazari, known as Ibn al-Firkah, died 729 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 352-353. 
4. He is: Ismail bin Yusuf bin Maktum al-Qaysi al-Dimashqi, Sadr al-Din, the Musnid Reciter, died 716 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 246-247; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 181-182. 
5. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 466; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 160-161; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 420-421; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 90. 
6. Thus mentioned by author, according to his birth date in biography sources, he died at 59.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He was skilled in Tafsir and Fiqh, authored in them, explained "Mukhtasar Ibn al-Hajib", and refuted Al-Isnawi. He was withdrawn from people, even jurists. 622 - And the Muhaddith Jamal al-Din [Yusuf (1) bin Muhammad bin Mas'ud al-Surramari] al-Hanbali. He heard in Baghdad from Al-Daquqi (2) and Al-Safi Abd al-Mu'min (3) and learned Fiqh from him, and Al-Siraj Al-Husayn (4) bin Yusuf. Then he came to Damascus and heard there from the companions of Ibn Abd al-Dayim. He became paralyzed at the end ... (5).
foot_note:
1. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources in: Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 557-558; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 476-477, quoting Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass by Al-Dhahabi though not in printed version; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 473-474; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 102. 
2. He is: Mahmud bin Ali bin Mahmud bin Muqbil al-Daquqi al-Hanbali, Taqi al-Din, died 733 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 3: 611-612; A'yan al-Asr 5: 406-407; Dhayl Tabaqat al-Hanabila 5: 44-50. 
3. He is: Abd al-Mu'min bin Abd al-Haqq bin Abdullah al-Baghdadi al-Hanbali, Safi al-Din, died 739 AH. Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 152; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 19: 245; A'yan al-Asr 3: 181; Dhayl Tabaqat al-Hanabila 5: 77-86. 
4. He is: Al-Husayn bin Yusuf bin Muhammad bin Abi Sari al-Dujayli, then al-Baghdadi, died 732 AH. Dhayl Tabaqat al-Hanabila 5: 30-33. 
5. Smudged in manuscript.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 623 - And the useful Muhaddith Abu Musa Muhammad (1) bin Mahmud bin Ishaq bin Ahmad al-Halabi, al-Maqdisi, al-Shafi'i, in Ramadan, aged about thirty. He heard in his youth from Ibn al-Khabbaz (2) and Ibn al-Hamawi (3), and with Ibn Jama'ah's care from / [196b] the companions of Al-Fakhr. He began working on a history of Jerusalem. 624 - And Al-Shams - also called Al-Amin - Muhammad (4) son of Chief Justice Burhan al-Din Ibrahim bin Ali bin Ahmad bin Ali bin Abd al-Haqq al-Hanafi, one of their notables, in Damascus, in Muharram, aged sixty-something. He was dignified, generous, and managed several positions. 625 - In Damascus, Muhammad (5) bin Abdullah al-Rumi, al-Safawi, al-Hindi, al-Dimashqi, in Muharram, aged 82. He was unique in hearing "Juz' al-Baytuta" from Ahmad bin Asakir. And Judge ... (6)
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 471; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 251; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 99. 
2. He is: Hafiz Musnid Shams al-Din Muhammad bin Ismail bin Ibrahim, known as Ibn al-Khabbaz, died 656 AH, previously cited under #343. 
3. He is: The long-lived Sheikh Ismail bin Umar bin Abi al-Fadl Ibn al-Hamawi, Diya' al-Din, died 727 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 208-209; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 178-179. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 391-392; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 333; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 464; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 289, dating death to 775 AH; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 89. 
5. His biography is in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 467-468; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 489; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 95. 
6. Unclear in manuscript.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: Hasan al-Hanafi, and Al-Sharaf Hasan (1) bin Abdullah bin Abi Umar, and Umar bin al-Qawwas, and Al-Sharif Ahmad bin Abd al-Rahman al-Husayni the Naqib gave him license. He wore the Sufi rag (Khirqa) from his father's master Safi al-Din al-Hindi. He memorized "Al-Tanbih" in his youth, and became proverbial in setting clocks/timing (Shadd al-Banakim). 626 - And Al-Jamal Yusuf (2) bin al-Izz Yahya bin Ibrahim bin Abd al-Aziz bin Abd al-Salam al-Dimashqi, in Jumada al-Ula, aged 88. He heard "Juz' Abi Musa al-Madini" from Ibn Musharraf, and narrated. 627 - And Al-Baha' Ahmad (3) bin Muhammad bin al-Husam Aqush al-Rumi al-Yunini their freedman, al-Dimashqi, the Muezzin. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Ibn Musharraf and Al-Hajjar. 628 - And in Aleppo, most likely, Abu al-Fadl Muhammad (4) bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Baqi bin Abd al-Ahad al-Halabi, the Sufi, aged over seventy-six. He heard "Mashyakha" from Sunqur, and narrated.
foot_note:
1. Died 695 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 446; Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 1: 313-314; Tarikh al-Islam 15: 810-811. 
2. His biography is in: Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 583; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 477; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 480; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 102. 
3. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 156; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 240; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 80. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, 378-379; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 236-237; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 284; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 467; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 475; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 93.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 629 - And Al-Kamal Ibrahim (1) bin Ahmad bin Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Mun'im bin Amin al-Dawla al-Halabi, Agent of the Treasury, in Jumada al-Ula, aged eighty-one. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" and "Mashyakha al-Muqatiliyya" (2) from Sunqur. 630 - And Al-Sharaf [Abu Talib] Abd al-Rahman (3) bin Abd al-Karim bin Muhammad bin Muflih bin al-Ajami. He heard "Rubaiyat al-Sahaba" and "Mashyakha Yusuf bin Khalil" from Abd al-Rahim (4) bin Muhammad Ibn al-Ajami. 631 - And in Cairo, its Musnid Abu al-Faraj Abd al-Rahman (5) bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Harun al-Tha'labi, Ibn al-Qari', in Dhu al-Qa'dah or al-Hijjah, having exceeded eighty slightly.
foot_note:
1. Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 376; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 206; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 67; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 452-453; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 6-7; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 77-78. 
2. It is his Mashyakha al-Kubra, Takhrij of Uthman bin Balaban al-Muqatili, died 717 AH, as in Mu'jam al-Ma'ajim wal-Mashyakhat 1: 383. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 376; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 332-333; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 86. 
4. He is: Abd al-Rahim bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman Ibn al-Ajami, Sharaf al-Din, Abu Talib, died 720 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 456; Dhayl al-Ibar by Al-Dhahabi, p. 115; Al-Wafiyat by Al-Zayn al-Iraqi, pp. 224-225. 
5. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 382; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 495-496; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 255; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 461; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 337; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 86.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He was unique in hearing "Juz' Ibn al-Tullaya" from Al-Abraquhi in (5), and heard from Ali bin al-Sawwaf his audible narrations of "Sunan al-Nasa'i", and narrated. 632 - And Al-Taqi Muhammad (1) bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Qadir bin al-Atraba'i, the Reciter, one of the signatories of Insha', aged about 75. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and "Sahih Muslim" from Al-Sharaf Musa al-Musawi and Muhammad bin Abd al-Hamid al-Hamadani, and Al-Dimyati gave him license. 633 - And Al-Shihab Ahmad (2) bin Hasan bin Abi Bakr al-Ruhawi, al-Misri, al-Hanafi. He heard "Al-Mi'ah al-Shurayhiyyah" from Hasan al-Kurdi, and "Ahadith Mansur bin Ammar" from Al-Wani, and narrated. 634 - And Abu al-Fatah Muhammad (3) bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Nashwan al-Judhami al-Misri, aged 67. He heard "Musnad al-Darimi" from Zaynab bint Shukr, and some of "Al-Sahih" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 396-397; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 239; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 477; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 94. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 393-394; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 37-38; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 370-371; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 119; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 78. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 397; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 313-314; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 191-192; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 82-83; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 97, listed there as: Muhammad bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Abdullah bin Abd al-Zahir.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He was among the signatories of the Dast (Royal Decrees), and came from a family of leadership. 635 - And Nasir al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Qawi al-Misri al-Kinani, Head of Muezzins at Al-Hakim Mosque, aged 74. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" with some omissions from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated. 636 - And Al-Siraj Umar (2) son of Judge Abd al-Aziz bin Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Jama'ah al-Kinani al-Misri, aged 55. He heard in Egypt with his father's care from Al-Wani, Yahya (3) al-Misri and others, and in Damascus from Sitt al-Fuqaha' (4) bint al-Wasiti, and narrated. He was not among ... (5). He taught at Ibn Tulun Mosque deputizing for his father.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 380; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 429; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 195; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 471; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 227; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 98, biography repeated twice consecutively. 
2. His biography is in: Irshad al-Talibin, pp. 52-53; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 395-396; Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 225; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 444-445; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 172; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 88. 
3. He is: Yahya bin Yusuf bin Abi Muhammad al-Maqdisi, then al-Misri, died 737 AH. A'yan al-Asr 5: 579; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 430-431. 
4. She is: Sitt al-Fuqaha' bint Ibrahim bin Ali bin Ahmad al-Wasiti, Amat al-Rahman, died 726 AH. Tarikh Hawadith al-Zaman 2: 143; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 288-289; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 15: 117-118. 
5. Smudged in manuscript. Al-Wali al-Iraqi said in Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar, quoted by Ibn Hajar in his Inba': He was not of praiseworthy conduct nor concealed inner self.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 637 - And Sutayta (1) bint al-Taqi Ali bin Abd al-Kafi al-Subki. She narrated from Hasan al-Kurdi and others. 638 - And Salah al-Din Khalil (2) bin Mawdud al-Basri, supervisor of Dar al-Hadith al-Kamiliyya. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated. 639 - And Judge Izz al-Din (3) son of Judge Al-Taqi Ahmad son of Judge Al-Izz Umar al-Maqdisi al-Hanbali. He heard "Mashyakha Ya'qub al-Fasawi" from the companions of Al-Kashghari. 640 - And the Khatib of Jerusalem Ismail (4) bin Ibrahim bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ibrahim bin Sa'd Allah bin Jama'ah al-Shafi'i, aged sixty. He heard the eighth [part] of "Al-Khil'iyyat" from Al-Khutani. 641 - And the Musnid Abu Bakr Muhammad (5) bin Qilij bin Kaykaldi al-Ala'i, aged 61.
foot_note:
1. Her biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 399-400; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 459; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 130; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 84-85. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 375-376; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 363; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 84. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 398; Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 206, dating his death: ... ninety and seven hundred; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 442; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 153, leaving death date blank. 
4. His biography is in: Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 398; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 456; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 363; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 82. 
5. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 355; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 144; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 97.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard with the care of his uncle Hafiz Salah al-Din al-Ala'i from Abu Nasr bin al-Shirazi and Al-Qasim bin Asakir. 642 - In Mecca, its Musnid Al-Jamal Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Abd al-Mu'ti, aged sixty-four and months. He heard much from his maternal grandfather Al-Safi, and his brother Al-Radi, and narrated. 643 - And Qan Uways (2) bin Hasan al-Kabir, ruler of Baghdad and Tabriz, and others, in Jumada al-Akhira, aged thirty-something. 644 - And in it, supposedly, Al-Fakhr Abu Bakr (3) son of Chief Justice Al-Husam Al-Hasan bin Ahmad bin al-Hasan bin Anushirwan al-Razi, al-Dimashqi, al-Hanafi. Abd al-Rahman (4) bin Warrida gave him license from Baghdad, and from Damascus Umar al-Qawwas, Ahmad bin Asakir, and Yusuf al-Ghasuli. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Ibn Musharraf, and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 376-377; Al-Iqd al-Thamin 1: 296-297; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 73-75; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 231-232; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 464; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 328; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 89. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 386-387; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 438; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 456-457; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 419; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 82-83. 
3. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 369; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 137; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 442, dating death to 786 AH; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 83. 
4. He is: Abd al-Rahman bin Abd al-Latif bin Muhammad, Kamal al-Din, known as Ibn Warrida, died 697 AH. Al-Muqtafi 2: 562-563; Tarikh al-Islam 15: 858-859; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 365-367.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: The Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Seven (777 AH) 645 - In it in Cairo, the Hafiz Baha' al-Din Abu Muhammad Abdullah (1) son of the Jurist of the Haram Al-Radi Abu Bakr bin Khalil al-Asqalani al-Makki, resident of Al-Hakim Mosque, in Jumada al-Ula, aged 82. He heard from Al-Tawzari, Al-Safi, and Al-Radi, and in Damascus from Al-Dashti (2), Ibn al-Nashu (3), Sulayman, and Al-Mut'im among others, and he dedicated himself to audition (Isma'). 646 - And the Judge of the Malikis Ibrahim (4) bin al-Alam Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Akhna'i al-Maliki. He heard "Thulathiyat Al-Bukhari", "Juz' Ibn Makhlad", and "Al-Amali" from Al-Hajjar, and from Al-Wani and others.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 330-331; Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass by him, pp. 126-127; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 408-411; Al-Iqd al-Thamin 5: 262-268; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 450-452; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 346-348; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 492-493; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 291-292; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 114-115. 
2. He is: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Qasim bin Badran al-Animi al-Dashti al-Hanbali, died 713 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 107-108; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 101-102; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 8: 82. 
3. He is: Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahim bin Abbas, Sharaf al-Din, known as Ibn al-Nashu, died 720 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 453; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 2: 213-214; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 3: 248. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 413-414; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 76-77; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 485-486; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 58-59; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 108; Raf' al-Isr, pp. 34-35.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 647 - And the Musnid Abu al-Hasan Muhammad (1) bin Umar bin al-Hasan bin Umar bin Habib al-Halabi, on the ninth of Jumada al-Akhira, aged 74 and months. He attended in the third [year] with Sunqur "Sahih Al-Bukhari", "Sunan Ibn Majah", "Muwatta' al-Qa'nabi", "Musnad al-Shafi'i", "Mu'jam Ibn Qani'", and "Maqamat al-Hariri", and from Baybars "Juz' al-Banyasi". 648 - In Alexandria, its Muhaddith Al-Taqi Muhammad (2) bin Ahmad bin Abi Bakr bin Arram. He heard from Al-Rashid Ismail (3) bin al-Mu'allim ... (4), and "Muwatta' Yahya bin Bukayr" from Musa al-Musawi. Students traveled to him, and he narrated. 649 - In Damascus, Judge of the two regions, Abu al-Baqa' Muhammad (5) bin Abd al-Barr bin Yahya bin Ali bin Tamam al-Subki al-Shafi'i, on 13 Rabi' al-Akhir, aged seventy.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 412-413; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 333-334; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 193; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 502; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 104; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 124. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 420; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 58-59; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 314-315; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 498; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 373; Al-Majma' al-Mu'assas 2: 638-640. 
3. He is: Ismail bin Uthman bin Muhammad al-Qurashi, known as Ibn al-Mu'allim, died 714 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 151-153; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 176-177. 
4. Smudged in manuscript, his biography sources did not mention what he heard from this Sheikh. 
5. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 237; Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 3: 210-214; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 406-408; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 250-251; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 248-254; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 499-501; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 171-174; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 490-481; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 121-123; Raf' al-Isr, pp. 360-364.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: (1) Fiqh and Usul. He deputized in judgment in Damascus for his relative Al-Taqi al-Subki, then held its judgeship upon the dismissal of Taj al-Din al-Subki for about thirty days, in the month of Ramadan year 59, then ... (2), then he was sent to Tripoli, then came to Egypt in the year 65, and held [judgeship of the Army] (3) there, then Chief Justiceship after the dismissal of Al-Izz bin Jama'ah from it voluntarily and the appointment of Ibn Jama'ah to it, then he was dismissed in Jumada al-Ula year 73 for Al-Burhan bin Jama'ah, then he took office on the fifth of Jumada al-Akhira. Then he held the judgeship of Damascus in year five, said to be seventy-four, and it was difficult for him, so he asked to be relieved, and was answered. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and "Sahih Muslim" from Al-Wani. 650 - And Al-Shihab Ahmad (4) bin Muhammad bin Abi al-Majd bin Abi al-Wafa' bin al-Marjani al-Dimashqi, in Jumada al-Akhira, killed as a martyr, aged 63. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar.
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript due to bad restoration, perhaps meaning: He was knowledgeable in Fiqh and Usul. 
2. Unclear word in manuscript, possibly: dismissed (uzila), as in his biography sources, and Al-Taj al-Subki was reinstated. 
3. Smudged in manuscript due to bad restoration, affirmation from biography sources. 
4. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 180; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 360-361; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 288; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 296-297; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 110.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 651 - In Baalbek, Al-Sharaf Muhammad (1) bin Abd al-Qadir al-Ba'li. He heard several Juz' from his father's uncle Musa al-Yunini, and narrated. 652 - And the Musnid Ahmad (2) bin Abd al-Karim bin Abi Bakr al-Ba'li, on the tenth of Rajab. He was unique in hearing "Sahih Muslim" from Zaynab bint Kindi from Al-Mu'ayyad (3). Umar bin al-Qawwas and Ahmad bin Asakir gave him license from Damascus, and he narrated "Sahih Muslim" in Baalbek and Damascus when Al-Taj al-Subki invited him there in the year seventy-one. 653 - And in Aleppo, Imam Al-Kamal Umar (4) bin Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin al-Ajami al-Halabi, aged ... (5). He heard in Aleppo from Abu Bakr (6) bin al-Ajami "Juz' al-Makhrami" and "Al-Marwazi", and in Hama "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar, and "Juz' al-Baytuta" from Ahmad bin Muzayz, and narrated.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 501; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 21; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 123. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 405; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 92-93; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 264; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 287; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 176-177; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 109. 
3. He is: Al-Mu'ayyad bin Muhammad bin Ali al-Tusi, then al-Naysaburi, Radi al-Din, died 617 AH. Al-Takmila li-Wafiyat al-Naqala 3: 26; Tarikh al-Islam 13: 532-533. 
4. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 179; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 406; Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 207-208; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 439; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 495-496; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 145-147; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 147; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 117. 
5. Smudged in manuscript, biography sources mention he was born in 704, so his age would be 73 years. 
6. He is: Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman al-Ajami, Shams al-Din, died 714 AH. Al-Muqtafi 4: 175-176; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 94-95.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 654 - And the Muhaddith Al-Sharaf Al-Husayn (1) bin Umar bin al-Hasan bin Umar bin Habib al-Halabi, brother of Al-Kamal mentioned previously, in Dhu al-Qa'dah, aged 65 and months. He heard in Aleppo from Abd al-Rahim bin al-Ajami "Juz' Muhammad bin al-Faraj al-Azraq", and from Ibrahim bin al-Ajami "Juz' al-Jabiri". 655 - In Homs, the Musnid Abu Hamid Abdullah (2) bin Ali bin Abd al-Malik bin al-Ajami al-Halabi, in Rabi' al-Akhir, aged near eighty. He heard the last nine Maqamat of "Maqamat al-Hariri" from Abd al-Rahman bin Salih bin al-Ajami, and narrated. 656 - In Mecca, Muhammad (3) bin Abdullah bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Salam al-Kazaruni al-Makki, the Muezzin, in Shawwal, aged 77. He heard "Sunan Abi Dawud" from Al-Radi, and narrated. 657 - In Damascus, the Musnid Umar (4) bin Ahmad bin Umar al-Awfi al-Salihi, the Muezzin, aged 78.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin, p. 88; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 417-418; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 44; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 491; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 65; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 112. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 408; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 344; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 375; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 113. 
3. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 239; Al-Iqd al-Thamin 2: 69-70; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 478; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 121. 
4. His biography is in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 496; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 153; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 118.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He narrated from Ibn Musharraf and Judge Sulayman "Musnad al-Shafi'i". 658 - In Cairo, the Musnid Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Safi bin Qasim al-Ghazuli, al-Misri, al-Dimashqi, the Sufi. He heard from Ali bin al-Qayyim a piece of "Mustakhraj al-Isma'ili", and from Sibt Ziyada "Juz' al-Jabiri", and from Zaynab (2) bint al-Is'ardi "Musnad al-Shafi'i", and narrated. 659 - And in Mecca its Emir, Ajlan (3), removed from office voluntarily, leaving it to his son.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 71-72; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah (twice) 3: 178, 394; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 319; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 119. 
2. She is: Zaynab bint Sulayman bin Ibrahim al-Is'ardi, Umm Muhammad, died 705 AH. Al-Muqtafi 3: 313-314; Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Al-Dhahabi 1: 249-250. 
3. He is: Ajlan bin Rumaytha bin Abi Numay. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 425; Al-Iqd al-Thamin 6: 58-73; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 493-494; Al-Durar al-Kamina 2: 453-454; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 115.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: The Year Seven Hundred and Seventy-Eight (778 AH) 660 - In it in Cairo, [Muhibb al-Din Muhammad (1) bin Yusuf bin] Ahmad bin Abd al-Dayim al-Halabi al-Misri al-Shafi'i, Supervisor of the Army in Egypt, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 81. He explained "Al-Tashil" and "Talkhis al-Miftah". He heard from Al-Tha'labi, Musa al-Musawi, Al-Hajjar, and Wazira. 661 - And Judge [Jamal al-Din Abdullah (2) bin Muhammad bin Ismail bin] al-Athir al-Halabi, al-Misri, the Secret Scribe (Katib al-Sirr) in Damascus, removed from office, in Jumada al-Akhira, aged about seventy. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Wazira and Al-Hajjar. 662 - In Damascus, the Jurist of Sham Al-Imad Ismail (3) bin Khalifa al-Husbani, aged sixty.
foot_note:
1. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources in: Al-Wafi bil-Wafiyat 5: 290-291; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 452-454; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 474-475; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 368-369; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 535-536; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 290-291; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 147-148. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, 437; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 449; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 340-341; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 526; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 140. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 450-451; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 283; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 399; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 519-520; Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyyah by him 3: 111-113; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 366; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 136-137.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: (1), and he heard "Musnad al-Shafi'i" from Zaynab bint al-Kamal, Al-Jazari, and Al-Mizzi, and narrated. 663 - And the Muhaddith Abu al-Ma'ali Muhammad (2) son of the Historian Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Abi Bakr al-Jazari, al-Dimashqi, aged 68. He heard from Al-Mut'im, Abu Nasr bin al-Shirazi, and ... (3). 664 - [And the Musnid Umar (4) bin Hasan bin Mazbad bin] Umayla al-Maraghi al-Mizzi the Muezzin, in Rabi' al-Akhir, aged 98. He was unique in [hearing] "Jami' al-Tirmidhi" and "Sunan Abu Dawud" from Al-Fakhr, and he heard his "Mashyakha al-Zahiriyyah" and its "Dhayl" (Supplement) (5), and was unique from Ibn al-Mujawir in hearing "Amali Ibn Sam'un" ... (6).
foot_note:
1. Smudged in manuscript, his biography sources did not add more teachers than mentioned here. 
2. His biography is in: Al-Mu'jam al-Mukhtass bil-Muhaddithin by Al-Dhahabi, p. 254; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 437-438; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 364-365; Ghayat al-Nihaya 2: 236; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 285; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 157; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 146. 
3. Smudged in manuscript. Biography sources mention several teachers, adding to those mentioned: Ibn Musharraf, Al-Hajjar, Al-Qasim bin Asakir, and multitudes. 
4. Text in brackets smudged in manuscript, affirmation from biography sources in: Mu'jam al-Shuyukh by Taj al-Din al-Subki, Takhrij al-Hafiz Ibn Sa'd, p. 312; Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, pp. 432-433; Dhayl al-Taqyid 3: 212-214; Ghayat al-Nihaya 1: 590; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 2: 442-444; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 530-531; Al-Durar al-Kamina 3: 159-160; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 142-143. 
5. Fakhr bin al-Bukhari has more than one Mashyakha, one is Takhrij of Hafiz Jamal al-Din Ahmad bin Muhammad al-Zahiri, died 696 AH, and Hafiz al-Zahiri has a supplement to it, and Hafiz Jamal al-Din Yusuf bin Abd al-Rahman al-Mizzi, died 742 AH, has a supplement to the mentioned Mashyakha. Mu'jam al-Ma'ajim wal-Mashyakhat 1: 364-365. 
6. Smudged in manuscript. In Dhayl al-Taqyid: The twenty Amali of Ibn Sam'un, and biography sources list his audible narrations.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 665 - [And Muhammad (1) bin Ali bin Isa bin Mansur, Badr al-Din, known as Ibn] Qawalij al-Halabi al-Dimashqi al-Hanafi, on 3 Shawwal, aged 83. He was unique from Ahmad bin Asakir in [hearing] "Sahih Muslim" attending him in the third [year], and from Umar bin al-Qawwas in [hearing] "Amal al-Yawm wal-Layla" by Ibn al-Sunni attending him, and he heard ... (2), and "Fada'il al-Sham" by Al-Raba'i, and attended "Sahih Al-Bukhari" with Hafiz Abu al-Husayn al-Yunini, and narrated. 666 - And the Musnid Ibrahim (3) bin Ahmad bin Ibrahim bin Falah al-Iskandari, al-Misri, al-Dimashqi, in Dhu al-Hijjah, aged 83. He was unique from Umar bin al-Qawwas ... (4). 667 - And Al-Shams Muhammad (5) bin Umar bin Mahmud al-Khurasani, then al-Dimashqi. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Ibn Musharraf and Al-Hajjar.
foot_note:
1. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 448; Dhayl al-Taqyid 1: 312-313; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 3: 191; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 533-534; Al-Durar al-Kamina 4: 80; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 145. 
2. Smudged in manuscript, biography sources detail his hearings. 
3. His biography is in: Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar by Al-Wali al-Iraqi, p. 454; Dhayl al-Taqyid 2: 206-207; Ghayat al-Nihaya 1: 5, dating death to 780 AH; Durar al-Uqud al-Faridah 1: 68; Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 517; Al-Durar al-Kamina 1: 7; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 134. 
4. Followed by smudge in manuscript removing the last line. In Al-Dhayl 'ala al-Ibar: He attended Mu'jam Ibn Jami' with him, and other sources list his teachers. 
5. His biography is in: Tarikh Ibn Qadi Shuhbah 2: 534; Inba' al-Ghumr 1: 146, both quoting Tarikh Ibn Hijji which has not reached us.

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: 668 - And Al-Badr Muhammad (1) bin Ahmad bin Umar al-Sukkari al-Misri al-Sulami. He narrated "Musnad al-Shafi'i" from Wazira, and narrated. 669 - In Baalbek its Musnid, Al-Badr Muhammad (2) bin Ali bin Muhammad bin Umar al-Isfahlaz al-Ba'li al-Hanbali, in Rabi' al-Akhir. He heard from Al-Qutb al-Yunini "Juz' ...", and "Juz' ..." (3), and narrated. 670 - And Al-Kamal Yusuf (4) bin [Abdullah bin Hatim bin Muhammad] al-Ba'li, Ibn al-Habbal, on 7 Rajab, aged one hundred years save two. He heard "Al-Sira" from Al-Taj Abd al-Khaliq, and was unique with it. 671 - In Hama, Umar (5) bin Muhammad bin Abi Bakr al-Hamawi al-Shafi'i, Ibn al-Samin, aged 73.
foot_note:

book_title: Tadhyil al-Dhayl (Supplement to Al-Iraqi's Supplement on Al-Ibar)
text: He heard in Hama from Nakhwah (1) bint al-Nasibi the ninth [part] of "Mustakhraj Abi Nu'aym on Sahih Al-Bukhari". 672 - In Cairo, Muhammad (2) bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Muhammad bin Abd al-Wahid al-Artahi al-Misri, Ibn al-Mufassir, at the beginning of Rajab. He heard from Muhammad bin al-Mukarram "Awali Tirad", "Al-Arba'un al-Buldaniyyah" by Al-Silafi, "Amali Ibn Mahmash", and "Al-Nasikh wal-Mansukh" by Al-Hazimi, and was unique with it and his hearing of "Ulum al-Hadith" by Al-Hakim. He heard "Sahih Al-Bukhari" from Al-Hajjar and Wazira, and narrated. 673 - And Al-Badr Muhammad (3) son of Judge Abd al-Ghani bin Yahya bin Abdullah al-Harrani, al-Misri, al-Hanbali, in Rajab, aged about 78. He heard from Ibn al-Qayyim the first part of "Awali Sufyan", and from Zaynab bint Shukr (4).
